Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

mjAWJRconFliRExR03tuPg.text: The service was fantastic , quick prompt attentive. The food was fresh delicious and healthy something for everyone and great portion sizes. Very nice atmosphere since the remodel as well. Full service after 3 pm so would recommend coming at this time!

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Superfood salad and hummus Salad
Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

HqrKWmm5erYYaU55197xhQ.text: Bravo to Brent and Jayme for trying to bring a positive resolution to my previous 1 star review. Long story short, after they moved on from the staff member I had a negative experience with, that guy messaged me on Yelp and harassed me. Not a big deal, more funny than anything. I wanted to bring this to Brent and Jayme's attention because obviously he represented their business.  After speaking with them and learning, through Brent, that the same ownership group who owned Tempe Public Market also owned Ghost Ranch (which is next door to them) and St. Francis (one of my favorite restaurants ever) I decided to take Brent and Jayme up on their offer to give this place another shot.  Much more pleasant experience with the staff on the second go round, seriously the enjoy vibe of this place changed from my initial visit. You can tell the feedback Brent and Jayme have received from me, as well as other customers has been taken seriously and changes have been implemented.  On this latest visit I decided to try the pizza, I went with The Rancher. I must say that this pizza is pretty damn amazing. It is my second favorite pizza that I've ever had in Phoenix metro (LGO still has the best but this is stiff competition). The pizza is a rectangular shape, was cooked perfectly and honestly might be enough for two people (I could only eat half of it).   I cannot wait to try more things (I'm thinking one of the house made bowls next time).   Thank you Brent and Jayme for reaching out to me, thank you for listening to my concerns and not taking them as an attack on your business. You clearly take pride in what you do here, which is very on brand for an Aaron Chamberlain restaurant. I will be back!

q07kcHeQVnZoLWEnMNzRdg.text: We went on a Friday evening. It was busy but we got seated within 10 mins. The atmosphere is hip and casual. One drawback was the heat - they don't have the greatest air flow, so it felt muggy.y wife ordered the BBQ pizza, which she wasn't a huge fan of it due to the flavor of the sauce. I ordered  the nachos which were great. We also ordered the Sun Devil fires - excellent. For dessert, we got the Oreo cookie, which was not great. It wasn't sweet. Overall, we would got back but not order the pizza or the Oreo cookie.

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. The cooking area and fresh desserts

93BU0m6EIunVMLFpTYbWBQ.text: We love this restaurant and the new redesign and food options. The falafel sandwich is my favorite so far!  My friend and I had excellent service from Alicia and Forbes! We will definitely be back and look forward to hopefully using this restaurant for catering services at one of our elementary school events!  Thank you!

dNTpea8kd2njcKAwprZ9Pg.text: Came here for the first time after reading about it on Pulling Corks and Forks blog. My husband is a celiac and I'm a vegetarian so we love menus that mark which items are GF VG and V.   Kirk waited on us and was awesome. Very attentive and took the time to ask is multiple items were celiac safe for my husband. The food is delicious and the dessert case is incredible! I got some s'mores cake to go :)

PADcvWoTjqkTTXzc75LDcQ.text: I love this place! Comfortable, stylish & hipster vibe! Great service! Just really really wish y'all had more VEGAN and GLUTEN FREE options such as tofu scramble, avocado toast etc. I had the Power Bowl which is the vegan option for the Power Burrito, without the egg & tortilla. I was very happy to see Vegan Gluten Free Banana Bread and will definitely treat myself to that next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

TC42akpfj3KJk8eN_qj-jA.text: Overpriced... under seasoned... underwhelming  This lunch salad and drink cost around $20 the chicken was not fresh .. a mini clump of gray chicken on the side of bowl mostly filled with cabbage ... sesame seeds and peanuts could have offered flavor but they were not toasted  ... and the orange was so pithy tasting it was undesirable.   No one checked on us ... the chairs were uncomfortable and the music was too loud  ... save yourself time and money and go anywhere else.

akr_OhuNlhOx5dKT1EdKUw.text: I want to love this place but I can't. Went today for lunch. The seemed understaffed and they are overpriced. Even with the "revamped" menu. We tried the Su devil fries for $9.25. That's right, almost $10 for cold fries with some Parmesan cheese. It came with two dipping sauces. One tasted like cocktail sauce. The BBQ chicken pizza was good. We also had grapefruit mimosas. They were probably the smallest I've seen. The bartender eyeballs the amount of wine she pours into the glass. The ice machine was broke so there was a tray of ice with a scoop and we were there long enough to need the restrooms. One was empty, no paper towels the entire time we were there. The other had napkins for paper towels. They brought the pizza without plates so we had to ask for plates not once but twice. Overpriced food and poor service.

945YwQ2BugBVwWEZGRzlcg.text: I came in with my friend Ben on a Tuesday afternoon starving and boy were we satisfied!  First, the service: INCREDIBLE!  Our hostess Kim was a wonderfully welcoming presence to greet us before we gorged on one of the best meals we've had in Tempe! The manager Forbes came by and asked us how everything was going. Excellent staff!  Also, the food: DELICIOUS! We really couldn't have asked for more. I had the Asian Citrus Salmon Salad and I felt so refreshed! My friend, Ben, had the fried chicken sandwich and he wouldn't stop talking about how wonderful the flavor was!  Overall, a great surprise in the Tempe area. Will definitely be heading back as soon as possible!

nsdTO8GNsimmwsLHp-NjHA.text: After a few visits to TPM, I've finally found a dish I love! My first few visits were mediocre, but the restaurant had just opened, so perhaps they were working the details out. During a recent visit to meet a friend, the meatloaf special on the menu sounded divine - and it WAS. You can say this is my new fave dish here. Bacon wrapped meatloaf with mashed potatoes and tomatoes. Oh yeah. Real good.

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Meatloaf with Mashed Potatoes

5mCNo-QxKj-85rnnrMEZoQ.text: Before yesterday, the few times I had been here was before the remodel and when Aaron Chamberlin was still involved. I can't help but feel that the quality of the food has decreased considerably from how it used to be. I came in yesterday for a working lunch, and ordered the lentil curry coconut soup and a side of fries. I was most looking forward to the fries, as they'd always been great on previous visits (and at the Phoenix Public Market Cafe).   When my plate was set down, I was immediately disappointed. Gone we're the good, thicker-cut and skin-on fries, and in their place was a bowl of pale shoestring fries that looked as if they came out of a bag from Ore-Ida. The soup wasn't great either - somewhat watery, unwieldy big chunks of potato, and unevenly cut fresh ginger (some pieces tiny and cooked through and other pieces large and crunchy and inedible).  I was so excited about this location when it first opened, but I'd have to think twice about stopping in again.

a3vTppN3bcjdNbkstdUBDQ.text: The new vibe is great the bartenders Erin and josh were True ambassadors.  Great food. The only thing missing was Peixoto Coffee from downtown chandler Farm to cup

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Erin and Josh fantastic mixologists.   Thank you for great service and wonderful recommendations

bBqnuwZ1aa_yRFmXmMtKlg.text: Tempe Public Market Cafe  Another Aaron Chamberlain creation, very modern and simple. Order at the counter, get your number and they bring it to you, good size bar, seating inside with just rows of tables and an extensive outside patio area for seating.  Pork Chile Verde Pot Pie - House baked in a flaky crust filled with chucks of pork in a medium hot chile verde stew. I would say this may be their signature dish. I had this at the Phoenix Public Market and loved it as I did here.  The Rancher Pizza - Schreiner's sausage, pepperoni, cheese blend, house made tomato sauce, good combination of ingredients on a good pizza dough cooked just right.  AZ Burger - green chile, cheddar, lettuce, house dressing, good generous size burger served with fries, that all the ingredients work well together.  House Pretzels with jalapeno white cheddar sauce. Fresh handmade pretzels that are delicious.  All the food is well prepared and seem very fresh and good quality.  No wait on a Thursday evening with plenty of seating inside and outside of the restaurant with a few monitors but not over bearing like a sports bar.  Enjoyed the experience and would definitely come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. House Pretzels with jalapeno white cheddar sauce
Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. The AZ Burger
Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. The Rancher - Schreiner&#39;s sausage, pepperoni, cheese blend, house made tomato sauce

tOq8o2x-HoNK3_6JNCyNTg.text: Where do I begin? I grew up in South Tempe and we desperately needed TPMC here, very limited options in the neighborhood that are all big chains with no local offerings what so ever.   If you haven't been in recently go and check it out, they did a fantastic remodel on the entire restaurant. The decor, food, and drinks are all outstanding. Yes some things have changed but it's all for the best, the new dishes and cocktails are fantastic. If you haven't been yet go and check it out you won't regret it.   My favorite part is the fact that they've gone full service for dinner and brunch, if you live in the So Tempe area you know this was greatly needed, who doesn't like having a server while relaxing on the patio after a long day of work, I know I do.   One last thing, they offer happy hour all day, from 11am to 7pm, that's huge I know of very few places that offer this kind of drink deals in the valley.

2ovBrXudn6Gs_7XZcaP1ug.text: I went here last Sunday night and had one of their $12.99 Community Dinners. These dinners are a very good value for the portion sizes.  I had the fried chicken, mashed potatoes salad and dessert, which was soft-serve vanilla with sprinkles on it.   The chicken was good but a little on the greasy side. I was however delighted that there was a kale salad served with it that wasn't mentioned on the menu.  I thought the service was good and liked the atmosphere. It's impossible not to compare this with the downtown Phoenix location, which has a pulse of its own and is one of my favorite restaurants in the Valley. But, if you're not familiar with their food and in the East Valley, it's well worth trying this place out and it's likely to become one of your favorites.  Note: The patio has misters.

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sunday Night Dinner Special Fried Chicken
Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salad as part of 3 Course Sunday Night Dinner Special for 12.99.

Qis-MHIoCqrPSjzkTzumHw.text: I have been to Tempe Public market several times and it's usually.....ok. They have a happy hour, which I can appreciate, but their drinks are nothing terribly special. I usually get the sangria because their other cocktail on special is spicy (I just can't get into spicy cocktails, not my thing). I have tried a few food items that are also just fine, but not worth going out of your way to get. Their pizzas look decent, so I would like to try those and their baked goods aren't bad either.  I know they are going through renovation and a change in ownership, so maybe it will be better in the near future.

8eUIbvr1YQLgHu2gz1rjjA.text: This place is awesome! Great atmosphere and food. Tyler was our server, and he was so cool. Helped recommend all the best apps and entrees! Go for the nachos. They are A-mazing!

nPPOnYdA_3gjCsM1-g5WoA.text: I was in town visiting a friend of mine. She brought me to this place swearing it was the best. I'm a huge pastry fan, I really enjoyed the pastries they had.  their bagels....I don't think I've ever had a yummier bagel than the one I tried at Tempe Public.  LT who's the pastry chef, was very nice! Definitely recommend!

UgtZgMkYXB2Yt3DjvRfqCA.text: Had a nice Saturday lunch here. Sophia at the bar was excellent and the food and drinks were great. Will visit here again.

GRTH8J-HxB2VPYpoGs4LXA.text: This was my first time here. A group of us met for lunch on a chilly Arizona afternoon. The dining room was pretty crowded so we sat outside. It was such a beautiful day and the patio was quite enjoyable.   We were served right away and the cashier was efficient and personable. Our food came out quickly in spite of the crowd. This was impressive as I expected our food to take much longer.  Good job here. I thought the food was on the pricey side, however.   I enjoyed a slice of the quiche and a latte. It quiche was pretty good, but the slice was on the smallish side. It came with a side salad which was very good. The dressing was light and tasty. My latte was the perfect temperature and I enjoyed it. The best part of all was the company of course. If I'm going to enjoy time with friends in a nice atmosphere, here is where I'd go.   When I return next, I'd like to try the breakfast options and will plan to update my review then.

vfij3CkkZB0yc3-9QCjaCw.text: I've always had this place in mind since it looks like a great place to eat at and I wasn't disappointed at all! I ordered the flanched flarney garney and it was delicious. Very well cooked scrambled eggs with a nice crispy bacon and a nice touch of mayo with guacamole. I would recommend this dish for sure! Also great designed location and a perfect patio to enjoy a nice meal. On top of that the service was great and very fast to get your order. I will be back!

ncYK64iNzsgzjR4qIv7jmA.text: Waited an hour for two Bloody Mary drinks, ordered at noon on a Veteran's Day.  Was told by the bartender, "Well, I'll be out of commission for awhile," while sighing and ambling about his work.  No thanks! Sorry buddy, sour grapes about a day off, much...?

md-D_QOxgQGOdPe_6AT2Aw.text: Nothing was seasoned at all! I got the chicken sandwich ($11), and my friend got the AZ burger ($12). The chicken sandwich's only redeeming factor was that it was way too sweet, and the AZ burger was just just too plain (it looked like there was sauce on it, but we couldn't tell what the sauce was because the burger as a whole was just so bland). For the price, the cafe is not worth it.

Tbj6N7M9JMjSTRyFJCuUyw.text: This is an awesome place - great food and atmosphere.  We went for lunch today, sat outside on their huge patio near the fireplace.  We both had the Cubano which was amazing!!  Can't wait to go back!!

y_Q396l1sM_nnJd1lyN1OQ.text: We love this place. Literally anything you get from here is great and comes out fresh. The only downside to this restaurant is how long the line gets at peak hours, around lunch and dinner time. It can get crazy long and wrap through the restaurant.

vhPGOJAUcoAirxIjd_-qUQ.text: Really cool decor and atmosphere. Lots of seating. Yummy sounding food choices ! It looks pretty trendy and upscale. We stopped just on a while while running errands this week.  The person who took our order was either annoyed or maybe the music was too loud but I didn't get a welcome feeling.   My husband ordered a burger. Not bad but not overwhelmingly great. The bun was yummy though.   I ordered a grilled cheese and seriously... ANYWHERE makes a better grilled cheese. The bread was dry. The cheese was barely there. And there wasn't any flavor. I ate half. Tried to share some with my kiddo who was not interested at all... And finished off my husband's burger. The price for the grilled cheese is ridiculous especially when THAT was what I got. I was really excited and was super disappointed.   The fries were decent. Not worth the  $4 side charge though. We ate maybe half each.   My husband told the manager I guess (?) About the sandwich and he didn't offer any solutions or obviously have any knowledge on what to even say. We aren't mean or throw fits. But we do expect quality when the cost is is this tier.  The macaroon was AMAZING though. So there's that.  I don't think we will be back.

enAiuXJ1HW8CZi3PCXNp6Q.text: It's been awhile since I went to a restaurant and was blown away by the entire experience. Everyone who works here was super friendly,  the place was immaculate. Our food was fresh and hot, and delicious. Crispy chicken sandwich was so good.  My fiance had the Cubano which was excellent. I would definetly recommend this place and can see this place becoming a new favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cubano sandwich,  great choice... you won&#39;t be sorry.
Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Crispy chicken sandwich with coleslaw,  omg...delish!

4gJoj2wW4uVcllOhTHqv1g.text: Well, we had high expectations for this place. Always hear good things about the one in Phoenix. Since Tempe, is seriously lacking good places to eat,we were very excited to check this place out. If you are on your lunch hour at work forget it ,you will never get your food and get out on time. 30 min we waited for our order. The place is very crowded,but, mostly with people that are waiting for their food,for a very long time. We came a little after 1pm,thinking the rush would be over. I know that they just opened recently. It seems as if there is a lot of folks working here that maybe have not worked in a restaurant before. What might help is if they take orders at the table. Watching the staff run all around the place,inside and outside while looking for the table for the the number  has to be exhausting!  They have been open for a few weeks now. So they should be getting it together.We will give it another try, but it will be awhile.

e-CrpJPbSRrbX-j36x0Leg.text: The Tempe region, especially around ASU, has transformed wildly over the past decade. Its southern part also has experienced a similar transformation - but quieter and and organically. Tempe Public Market Cafe is one example. With generous open seating areas suitable for family with kids, to a bar area that blends in nicely to cater to adults who just want to unwind, this place hits all spots.

bfDwoBgZrMwJAONxX7o2kg.text: Update 12/23/18: Six of us had an early dinner at TPM.  What a disappointment!  I had talked it up to out of town family members, based on a prior visit, which I had rated as 5 stars.  Where to start:  service/food was s-l-o-w, hamburgers were bone dry, a child was served a quesadilla LOADED with inedible hot chili peppers (had to order and pay for another plain one), soup & salad was unremarkable and the cubano sandwich was just ok. The grilled ham and cheese, however, was very good.    Would have ordered additional drinks but there wasn't a server in site.    Best part of our visit:  there were some damn cute dogs in the patio.  We really want this place to make it.  We like the decor and the vibe, but we want better food, presented in a more appetizing manner.

zg8cY2FFgNfCfSLEvRCN-w.text: Look there isn't much in the area, it has a great look and feel from the street and the menu looked to be nosh snob friendly. This ended up being the foodie equivalent of a bad Hollywood blockbuster.... initial excitement and hype, great trailers and lots of shine.... Only to be followed by bad acting, poorly executed special effects and a plot that went nowhere.  The only bright spots were the service and the fact that they had PBR in a can..(yes even well travelled foodies beer slum).  The pizza was meh at best. The fries were acceptable. The pasta was well.... I knew I shouldn't have ordered it...but like dating a stripper on parole (yes I know...but....), sometimes you refuse to listen to that little voice in your head until it is too late....  If you are in a pinch and need a place with a long wait and great ambiance and decent'ish food this isn't a bad decision...  But if it burns later, don't say I didn't warn you...

Twuk4dYOjaL7PGlzp9z4CQ.text: Tonight I had the roasted cauliflower. This was a culinary masterpiece. It was as amazing to eat as it looked. They roasted a call flour and then put it on a bed of delicious, smooth mashed potatoes. Then they sprinkle it with a vegan au jus and roasted almonds.  Very unique!

yHyC9QI4ofSqYzHSZbPxAg.text: Love this place ! Have an amazing pizza and vegan options as well , which is amazing !

TjxKL41Pf1ncYyhNp1Q1gg.text: Disappointing.  After so many great meals at the PHX location we had high hopes for this spot.    Disappointing and flavorless food.  I won't be back to this location

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

EGCftZQ7OEH16ZN9O1e1uA.text: Came here with my sister a few months ago and had great food and srv. Today's been half hearted lack of service..waited 20min for a bloody Mary which was not worth the wait!  I had spoke highly of this place to my boyfriend and now I wish we hadn't stopped in.

q4bsIs3q-s-mG7VWaC2lpQ.text: First time leaving a review, I literally created an account to do so.  Where to start? My family took my mother here for her birthday dinner last night. She was happy with her food, but the rest of us?  I wasn't feeling super hungry, so when we each placed our orders, I asked for the pretzels with cheese and a side of bacon. What came out was a stale, stiff, bland hunk of bread, with a melted puddle of flavorless Velveeta. As for the side of bacon? They crunched up a bit and put it the cheese.  Half our orders came out 20 minutes late, too. When they finally delivered the pizza, it too was boring and flavorless. We put it in a to-go box on the off chance that maybe it would make a decent 2am snack if it was smothered in enough condiments to make you forget what you were eating. It didn't.  Oh, then there's the layout. Given the location, they have a huge amount of real estate, but the out door area is primarily unused space, with too few tables. What's more, half the tables don't even have chairs! People standing around holding their plates of food, which grow cold waiting for a place to sit...  On top of that, the entrance is arranged in a matter that the line to the bathroom and the line to order are the same thing, creating confusion and disorganization. The icing on top of that cupcake is that you can't even see the menu until you're about to order!  I've never left a bad review before in my life, but this place absolutely sucked and I'll definitely not be returning, especially if their social media manager replies with the exact same canned message that's been sent to other reviewers instead of actually addressing the glaring issues with their service and quality of food.

x-ZkS5If_7Ft542SIJ1fZA.text: I was so stoked to have Tempe Public Market Cafe open so close to me - only 2 miles away! Hooray! South Tempe/West Chandler are really lacking local restaurants with nice patios, indoor/outdoor spaces and local fare.  So, when TPMC finally opened, I was pumped! Hooray! Let's do this! Well.. I guess that I have to say - so far - I have been let down.  I went to get out of my house on a nice day, to use the wifi and grab a bite for lunch. I had a coupon for a free cookie as it was opening week, so was happy to use that. I looked over the menu and finally decided I am going to do the chicken sandwich. Ok. Well to start - the prices here (well at least for the fries) are more expensive than the downtown location. I have already choked at the $3 that was being charged in addition to the sandwich downtown because these are "full-service" restaurant prices with no service. But $4 for fries? Ug. Hard pass. On with the chicken sandwich.  Presentation-wise the sandwich is beautiful. Nice big hunk of golden-brown battered chicken on bun with some slaw an pickles. Looks delicious. Cutting the sandwich in half - the chicken is juicy. Now - on to the flavor. Wait - what flavor? The chicken was juicy, the breading crispy - but there is zero flavor in the breading. Zero flavor in the beautiful slaw. The only thing that made this have flavor was the butter pickles. Completely disappointed.   Well, suffice to say - the cookie was the same. I am one of those strange people that likes the dough better than the chocolate in chocolate chip cookies, and once again, there was zero flavor in the dough. Just completely missing something. As I am desperate for an awesome bakery like LGO around here to offer some semblance of a delicious baked good, neither the flavor, nor the size of the cookie suffices in comparison.  Service - well, I sat at the bar, and the staff seems very young and green. A bit clueless I have to say - drinks empty, no silverware delivered, no question of how my food was - asked for drink refills and silverware, finally ended up reaching over the bar and getting the silverware myself. Had to ask a second time for refill. Observation is not their skill set as of yet. Had to flag them down again for a box - twice.  The space itself - inside and out is beautiful. I love the patio - just needs more chairs - or tables at the long bench behind the bar. I am wondering what will happen come summer with the west side of the patio being unshaded, but so far, so good. Great patio space for sure.   So, once again for now, I will continue to my non-local (anymore) Four Peaks for delicious food, beverages, patio, and service as I have yet to be impressed by TPMC. I'm sure I will go again sometime in the future, but for now - I am going to go where I get an all-around better experience for the money.

vJ9LS8c10Vbfv1VgLlTGfQ.text: I'm a huge fan of the Phoenix Public Market Cafe; I almost never make it out to Tempe anymore but on opening weekend my friend and I decided to check it out! When I first got in there, it was so busy that a staff member came up to me and asked, "Are you looking for someone?"  And I said, "Yes, my friend..." scanning the room.  And she said, "Is it Michelle?"  And I'm like, "No, Andrea..."  I guess I wasn't the only one lost and confused amidst the buzzing of the crowd. No, seriously! I only told this tidbit of a story because that's how freakin' packed it was. It was the middle of the afternoon on a Saturday and the line snaked out the door.  I finally found my friend and we stood in line. 15 minutes passed...then 30...then 45! Yes, my dear Yelp friends, I stood in line for 45 minutes for food, something I only ever do if food is amazing. When we were finally helped, we both ordered Pancho Villa juices, which had jalepeno and pineapple in them. I ordered the Chile Pork Verde Pot Pie, a house specialty and my friend ordered the spicy chicken sandwich. The Chile Pork Verde Pot Pie tasted good, it had large chunks of pork in them and a good kick to it. My friend reported her spicy chicken sandwich tasted amazing and was worth the wait. We were both happy with our spicy jalepeno green juices, too! Overall, I love the space of the place; I wish that Phoenix Public Market Cafe was as big as this one, it was so relaxing to finally sit outside in the sunshine and enjoy our food. I can't say I'll be back to this location because I live way closer to the Phoenix one, but I could see how this could be a chill place to come and relax -hopefully not with a 45 minute wait on opening weekend!

_-UcFS3I97xgx49UCUpV1A.text: I have been two time now, the atmosphere is solid, the art is questionable, but it's all good.  Service was average at best, the order up was horribly slow and I really felt like I was at a McDonalds. My last time there, 4 people in front of me in line, 7:30, not that busy and it too 10-15 in line to order. Not good! Food came out normal time, but both times I've orders different items, and both times not impressed with the food, average at best, no real flare to anything and the it was quite costly, I guess they have to pay for all the renovations some how.  Sorry guys, Not going to make it a third time.

FYgrn-cQHxe2hjbGjd9wLA.text: Very DISAPPOINTED with my order of Lentil Curry soup. The soup was good but the serving size was NOT!! Because the menu offers both a cup a bowl size serving I made sure to ask the person taking my order to show me the difference before I placed my order. I was so excited to see how big a BOWL was and couldn't wait!! Unfortunately, I was beyond DISAPPOINTED When my soup came to the table. I couldn't believe how little soup actually comes in a "BOWL." I called over a service person who took the soup back and brought me a new bowl.  To my shock It was exactly the same amount as before! This time the server told me that it's a 10 oz serving to a bowl compared to a 6 oz in a cup.  My suggestion would be to maybe serve the "bowl" sized serving in a smaller bowl so you don't feel like you're serving a cup size but just in a bowl.  That being said, the soup was great! This picture is of the bowl before I took my first bite!

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

YI1_zXhIQOU-qeU3XcOfgA.text: LOVED IT!  I went there to meet up with a friend. I arrived late and was greeted slyly by our waiter, "We have been waiting for you." Haha! He totally made me laugh.  After such a great start, I didn't expect it would get better. I was wrong! Even though the happy hour menu was small, the selection was great! I got a sangria, chips and salsa (with came with three types of dips), wings for $18! What a deal! FYI: happy hour is until 7 pm, which I appreciate as it's next to impossible to even make the few happy hour venues that end at 6 pm.  Let's talk about the venue. Does anyone need an escape? This place made you forget you had a 10-hr day. A+ on the ambiance!  All in all, great service, yummy food, and amazing deals! I'm definitely coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

6-y6jR0XOwImX89bV7fxAQ.text: The place is nice but way over priced.  AZ Burger for $13 ... and a Falafel Sandwich for $12.50 ... are they insane? You can get a real authentic Falafel Sandwich made by real middle eastern owners for $5.50.  WTF TPM??? Other items were OK but not over the top for the prices they charge!!!

DzUI5gskzrUcxwtcffAhZw.text: Beautiful place, but not a great restaurant. Came for dinner at 6:30PM and they were out of the item I wanted, the backup choice, and the backup backup choice. Soda was also flat.   If they can actually keep things in stock, I'm sure it'll be a nice place.

4x2XDDlr3GHH1C7Vho_zgw.text: I really want to like this place. We were excited for the relaunch and hoped for a better experience. Over the last couple of months- I've been 4 times in a attempt to give it a fair shot.   The decor and seating is an improvement. Decor is so fun!   The food is still hit or miss. You'll either get really awesome fresh french fries or awful stale packets of grease- there's no in between.   The service is still lacking on attentiveness and promptness. Asking for a refill or a set of silverware can be painful. Each time I've had to ask for forks & knives and every time the server or manager has instructed me to look in the silver canister on the table for more forks (they were empty I already checked). Please don't instruct your customers on where to find them- I've already looked, that's why I'm asking you.   The superfood salad is always good (as long as the sweet potatoes aren't nasty with brown spots). Again- I love the fries as long as their fresh. It's up to you to determine when the fries will be served properly or nasty re-fried leftovers. The pizza has been consistently burned on the bottom. In general there is a lack of attention to details (supply levels on the table, cleanliness, refills and seasoning).   We may try again in a few months.

cuc9r_8Lb2td7zcJ1uzLPQ.text: This is a great addition to the neighborhood and I'm amazed at the size inside and out! The menus is huge with something for everyone from classic diner food to healthy. Vegetarian, vegan, dairy free.no problem. I started with coffee and stayed through lunch I loved the vibe so much! Their baked goods look amazing and the service was great. They can be very busy 11-12:30 but then it slows way down and the service was super quick. I had their Chino salad which essentially is a Chinese chicken salad with a ginger dressing that I found very bitter. Probably wouldn't order this again because of all the Napa cabbage but, that's my fault. The menu clearly states the ingredients. This is my 4th or 5th visit and I still love this spot. Newly decorated and quite different seating which I liked. I had the Asian salad with chicken $16, quite delicious, but maybe a bit over-dressed for my liking. Cram packed with fresh veggies and quartered oranges (real ones, not the canned type). Pricey but worthy.

uCz_DEOMlwJ-b00Delv__w.text: So we've given this place 3 tries and it's definitely out. Pity, since it's maybe half a mile from my house.   Three of us sat at the bar on a Friday afternoon about 2:00 or so and were 'helped' by a snotty brat with absolutely zero customer service skills.   I was the unfortunate one who got to sit underneath a giant speaker it was so loud that I could barely hear my friends talking so I asked the 'gentleman' if he would please turn it down a little. He generously agreed to turn it down a bit but made sure to let me know 'that if they got busy, he would have to turn it back up'.   It was all I could do not to laugh because there was maybe 3 tables in the whole place.  My friend and I both ordered the goat cheese cucumber sprouts sandwich, the del rel or something like that and what we got was two completely different sandwiches. Mine was dry, stale and gross. The cucumbers were curling from being old, the sprouts weren't fresh the bread was stale... all bad. Fries were old and cold... Ughhh.   We were absolutely ignored the entire time. I had to loudly ask for a refill as the little brat played on his phone.   It felt like he thought we weren't good enough to be in there or something. I haven't been treated that way for I really, really long time. I almost wanted to say 'yeah, I don't have makeup on and I am wearing yoga pants but it's my day off!'   Whatever, it was just a terrible Vibe. Will people continue to pay $9 for a crappy glass of wine and ear overpriced sub par food? Peace out.   Should be out of business shortly. Hopefully Postino's will go in there!!! That would be awesome!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Del Rel sandwich... Guess they didnt have any fresh veggies... There&#39;s a Sprouts right down the street man... No excuses.
Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chips, Salsa and Guac $8.00 during lunch $5.00 between 4pm - 7pm

NoZXLjnOJ8sVQE8NmGH6eQ.text: I loved Phoenix Public Market and couldn't wait for the Tempe location to open, but I have been here several times and the food and the service are underwhelming.   The food is okay but average. The coffee pot is self-serve and difficult to get to, and every time I've been in, it has been empty. It is difficult to track someone down who can take care of it, which leaves customers feeling like nobody is running the place.  They are also militant about their 11 am cut-off between breakfast and lunch. When I came in with a friend, they refused to even put her lunch order into their system because it was 3 minutes before 11 am. We understood if they weren't going to fill it for a few minutes, but they would not even take the order. They also made it clear that they wouldn't let us wait at the register for a few extra minutes in order to follow their rigid rules. They wanted us to move out of the way so that the people behind us could order. If we wanted to eat, we would have to go to the back of the line and start over again just so that we could time it absolutely perfectly. This was astoundingly bad customer service.  The best thing about Tempe Public Market is the architecture and design. It has definitely elevated the coolness in this south suburb strip mall! It is also a good place for meeting someone if you want a little bit of space to spread out. Unfortunately, the parts that matter most - the food and the customer service - consistently fall short.

dH1Ak0pyR0VHUYUGfuZb6Q.text: Really cool place! Such a great energy.   My friend had the cauliflower mashed potatoes and she said it was really good. I had the vegan ceviche which was good just personally I'm not a fan of spicy food but that was my fault!  The prickly pear iced tea was great. We checked in to Yelp and received a free cookie which was ok. Took a bagel to go for the am and it was great!  Would love to try something else since this place is awesome and service is too!

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vegan Ceviche

FkfotzQivP1Pwa2G8g2xZw.text: My wife and I stop in regularly. It has a great patio with an outdoor fireplace for winter nights. With table service for dinner and brunch it's my go to spot.  The food is consistently fresh and tasty.  Happy Hour is at the bar is a great way to start the weekend with a craft beer or cocktail.  Did I say the staff is friendly and fun? Well, they are!

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Friendly staff at Tempe Public Market Cafe!

bJMdlSxWRNsRiLXqaWYG4Q.text: I want to like Tempe Public Market Cafe. It's a great location and the open airy space has great vibes. They've added table service and our server was friendly. I was hoping that with the recent split from the Phoenix locations, Dave Chamberlin would overhaul the food. I was glad to see "Taste the Rainbow" is gone and there's a veggie udon dish now.   There are good food and drink specials from 3-7 PM. A few draft beers are $4 and select apps are $7.  Unfortunately, I didn't really like anything we ate. This has been pretty much True for me at all Chamberlin establishments. I get other people must like the food because they're doing fine, but it's just not my thing.  We got the Cauliflower Wings, a cheese pizza, and two beers. The panko crust on the cauliflower was nice and crunchy. I don't know if our order was put out wrong but there was nothing spicy--no wing sauce. The dipping sauce wasn't quite blue cheese or ranch and was just kind of blah.  The cheese pizza was just not great--the crust was somewhere between crispy and soft, the sauce was tangy but not flavorful. I just feel like at this price point the food should be better or, you know, good.   I'll stop in for a beer, but I think I'm kind of over the food.

jBEa6KmVnf1rvfrGVT5TUg.text: Tried out this place for the first time for Happy Hour. Tried the fries, they were tasty but soggy. So kinda disappointing. Carrot cake was YUMMY and moist. Wl definately try that again. The trail mix on top was wierd, so had to scrap it off. Service was hard to get their attention. But the whole place seemed clean. Music was way WAY too loud.

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Happy HAPPY Hour foods.
Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. View when walk in.
Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Happy Hour DRANKS

D9d6UreF_jnwu5hQH-ncEQ.text: Hunger strikes and u gotta answer that call. We just got done playing a death defyingly close match of tennis and needed to refuel. Ghost ranch restaurant was right next door and we originally wanted to go there, but they didn't have an open patio for my pooch, so we opted for this cafe.   Positives: 1. Inside seating as well as a huge open patio with plenty of seating. 2. Good-sized menu with a variety of options. 3. Four or more clean unisex bathrooms.  4. Tasteful design with a chill & relaxing atmosphere.   Now, let's get down to the nitty gritty. This is an order ur food at the counter kind of place. They were out of ice by the time we got our water, which wasn't a terrible thing cuz we got to the restaurant 40 min before closing, but the water tasted pretty funky. Maybe I'm just too used to the taste of bottled water. Yes, shame on me!!   Got the two entrees listed below and the Tito's cubano sandwich was the better of the two. It had good flavor and was even better when dipped in the horseradish sauce that it came with. The fries were limp & soggy. Not a good combination. Some things may be ok soggy, but limp, NEVER!!!   The superfood salad lacked flavor in every way, so I know it was very healthy, but definitely not worth $20!  Overall, this was a 3 star experience as the waitress was very nice and provided my pooch with a large bowl of ice cold water! How does a 4 legger get better treatment than the 2 leggers??? Guess I won't be back here til I grow 2 more legs!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Superfood salad with salmon!!
Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Tito&#39;s cubano!!

sCUVTOHjvr8t9Pygye4DbQ.text: I came in for brunch today. Based upon my reviews I think brunch is my favorite meal. They open at 7 and I got there around 7:30 so it was not very busy at all which I enjoyed. On the weekends they do table service so see the host to be sat. Service was fairly good, didn't have too much interaction with my server. I ordered an iced chai, pretty good, very sweet. They had many coffee options as well as a full bar. There was a good amount of options on the menu. I went with the grits which had braised pork, two eggs and toast. On their own the grits were pretty flavorless. No butter or even salt. But they were good with the pork. The texture of the grits was really good though. The interior of the restaurant was really cute. Would be a fun place to meet up with some girlfriend and grab a meal and maybe some drinks

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breakfast sandwich
Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Iced chai
Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Grits

TWtaDxbLv1TYdQHJQsjjEQ.text: Went to lunch here recently (on a weekday) with the oldest kid. He had the Cubano sammie with fries and I had the Asian salad. They were both good.  The place has an interesting vibe and is noisy. Most of the (self-seating) tables were taken by 11:30. Food is ordered at the counter and brought out to you. I'm fine with that. Menu-wise, they appear to have something for everyone.  Due to noise level, this would be a great place for kids. But not the place if you really want to enjoy conversation with your dining companion(s).  On our way out, we grabbed a couple of chocolate chunk cookies to go (they have a great looking bakery case). I mean, c'mon! We're not heathens.

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

9CPdlSalpg9aq7UsUGyh2w.text: This review is for drinks and service at the bar. We came here post dinner from a different location. The drink menu here is very diverse and offers unique options such as the SCHRUTE FARM featuring mezcal, beet juice, celery shrub, lime, and simple - which we fell in love with! Josh really took his time crafting the beverages to ensure they come out picture perfect, and mentioned that he would also be willing to make custom drinks not featured on the menu. The restaurant manager also took the time to follow up with us to ensure we had a great experience while we were there. Five Star service from both Josh and Forbes! We can't wait to come in for brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. SCHRUTE FARM mezcal, beet juice, celery shrub, lime, simple

Nr_kVPlGZhH4apfuB2a23Q.text: We ate here a few months ago and the food was delicious, the wait was nonexistent, and the prices were reasonable. At the time, the restaurant was seat-yourself, order and pay at the register, but now you must wait to be seated, wait to have your order taken, and wait to pay. The menu on the wall (which had more (and better) options) is no longer available.  The cocktail we had was called something like The Tempe Fizz. I assumed it would be at least lightly carbonated - wrong. The flavor was lackluster, and the ice inside the wine glass made the drink difficult to consume (I had to grab straws from the bar because our server took so long to come back).   I had the green chili pork pot pie. The server said it was very delicious and a little spicy. Not only was there no spice, but it had a funky taste that I can only describe as "old". The puff pastry on top was delicious, though! Kiddo had a pepperoni pizza - probably best meal anyone had! The pizza was really yummy, and the giant pepperonis were crispy and full of flavor! The other person in our party had the crispy chicken sandwich. It was spicy, but the sandwich had so much sauce and salad mix on it that it wasn't able to be eaten by hand, and they had to use silverware. Their side salad was also overdressed.   If you try this place, stick to a pizza at the bar and drink something you already enjoy on tap or canned/bottled. The pizza was by far the best portion of this meal!

UVNYii5vDyOJMpITTRhMDw.text: I used to love their salad, sandwiches and grilled salmon. This is our first time revisiting the restaurant after its renovation. I am seriously disappointed with their new menu and the quality of food. I think the new menu try too hard to put super food in everything in a weird way. The dishes are designed in a combination of sweet and salty things. Because I am out of choices of more of a "normal" American food that is more like the ones you will get from a farmer's market, I ordered a safe choice. Kids grill cheese sandwich. Oh my goodness is it hard to chew! They also managed to burn a kids cheese pizza. My husband's nobel cristal is also hard to "saw" through, literal you can't cut through it. My daughter ordered a crispy chicken breast ( not crispy) and comes with no ketchup or any dipping sauce. It is dry and chewy.   Not coming back. I am sad to lose this neighborhood restaurant. Used to love it.

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Burnt pizza
Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chewy and dry grill cheese sandwich

2qW35CxjKDt9W-HlctrwYw.text: Living down the street I really wanted to love this place, but after the 3rd attempt I'm done. Love the atmosphere but everything else was a disappointment, including the food. We were here on a Thursday for happy hour & literally there was one other table there. The service was horrible!! Took 20 min to get my 1st cocktail & another 20 to put an order in for food. We also literally had to go to bar to get another drink. Talked to manager after and she actually said it was her fault for not paying attention to her staff because she was busy in the back. What!!! We saw her was sitting in a booth in the front of the restaurant on a laptop. What ever!! Definitely won't be back! But management didn't seem to mind.

6-P4Y5N2s5LifYVsPHQQ_g.text: This place just got remodeled but still doesn't have a successful business model.   When we visited the place it had lots of staff running looking busy helping the 4 tables of customers for the 10 plus staff.  It might take you 15 minutes to order your food as your server is probably too busy discussing  how many people should we have standing at the front of the restaurant.   What about the food? Let's start with a cold brew then add cream and cinnamon syrup.   This turned out to be a glass of cream with a splash of coffee and with the hint of someone eating cinnamon a few states away.  The chicken quesadilla: imagine it is 3 in the morning and you returned home desperate for something to eat. You take some boiled chicken breast with no seasoning and all of the cheese you have in the house and put it in tortilla.  Melt it and enjoy that disappointment.   Overall, hard pass.

Yh5AbTyv1cwLHzmSYMRniw.text: Place has cool Ambience. Service was great! Had the cuban sandwich. Good but really filling. Nice place in the middle of south Tempe.

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cuban sandwich

VzFLhFzfDgRTrBb028iHAA.text: This place is super cute. You can tell they put some money into making it inviting yet trendy. That's about where all the excitement ends.   We arrived about 7:30 on a Saturday night. It was busy but not crazy. Two groups in front of us - group of 4 and group of 6.... It took 25 minutes to take their orders...I wish I was kidding.   While we were waiting I hopped over to the bar to grab a beer. Beer selection is sad. Who doesn't carry Dos Equis lager? Also, the hefeweizen here is probably my least favorite one. The bar staff was okay if that means you have to ask for a glass and an orange wedge, also I'd suggest not tossing the receipt and pen at your customers ( or anyone that you've just met for that matter).   We grabbed a seat and waited.. and waited. Our food took about 45 minutes to arrive. I ordered the special pizza on the board margarita and my dinner date had a burger.   My pizza looked like the kitchen is either a. lazy b. Ran out of food or c. The restaurant is loosing money. Heirloom tomatoes are wonderful however not when they are the cherry variety and cut in half. That nice mushy seed guts all over is not appetizing. I also found it strange that instead of slicing the basil it was thrown whole leaves randomly on top (a whole 4 leaves). Just yuck. Sadly it was also close to flavorless. The whole thing missed it's mark.  My dinner dates burger was not cooked to the requested color and served with room temp fries. He asked for the green chilies on the side... They were served cold.   Also as mentioned in other reviews here the staff looks lost and wonders around. This place needs some serious intervention!! Someone save it!! It's so cute on the inside and the patio looks lovely!! Maybe just bring a packed meal?

u-nC8Vj8oQbU3O3xNanFnA.text: So sad that they changed the rancher pizza for square thicker crust baked in a pan to the same ol' same ol' mediocure round pizza with very little toppings.  I won't be back.

VV__w2UcBIam3kOz8oR7Cw.text: It seems that now that the excitement of this place has worn off, it's much easier to get in. We live in the neighborhood and walk over and can easily find a seat now we enjoy their happy hour and service at the bar, instead of going to the cash register to order. We like the full service. I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because of the limited menu, and prices. We normally split a salad and an entree between the two of us and the portions are just right by sharing. Last night we had the ginger Asian salad and the New York strip steak with mashed potatoes. It was very good and I would order it again. The steak was tender and cooked perfectly. The bartender was our waiter/server and he was very friendly. We will be back!

g9n-DGndjB_k2mcx7e0Q4A.text: The quinoa bowl was terrific - so many veggies, and topped with 2 nicely poached eggs. Their version of a PB&J (with almond butter, apples, and jelly) looked great - and fun! Was not so impressed with the Flanched Flarney Garney (although the name is great fun) - it's a breakfast sandwich. Meh.  Best of all is the service. The staff are friendly and helpful - offered to turn the music down "a notch" for my older friend's benefit. They're been exceptional every time.

sP0eN3QxJfYg7cKO2aR8iQ.text: We are having lunch today at Tempe Public  Market and my wife ordered the Quiche. The order came but was cold in the center. She could not get the attention of the wait staff and took the dish back to the counter. They said they would provide a replacement meal. After 15 minutes and 3 conversations with staff, her quiche finally showed up.  In fairness, the manager brought the dish and apologized with a coupon for a free quiche should we come back here.  We won't go back again!

qLlhpFKgGyTiSHwJD8vd6A.text: Love the atmosphere, open and friendly, spot for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Love when they have a good special. Hamburger is fab. Chicken is delicious. Great veggies and lighter options. Plenty of food and can't miss on the desserts. It is run very well, open to experience a great meal. I think it is perfect for us on the chandler border and travel often to meet people here. So glad they expanded from downtown Phoenix. We even have a T-shirt because we love this place! Eat here!

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

dIoysgO9ENQWLEHgqwe2jA.text: 2 stars for the wait and cold food on a carry-out order.  Do not attempt to order pizza along with other hot food items.  They will be cold by the time you get home and I live down the street from them.  My daughter decided to grab a carry-out around 8pm this past Friday.  I ordered Friday's pizza special, Margherita, Sun Devil Fries and a ballerina cookie; my daughter ordered the fried chicken.Paid and sat down near the ice machine.  About 15 minutes later, a carry-out (bagged)   order was dropped off on the counter next to the machine, there were 2-3 staffers standing near by; looked at it but didn't pick it up nor call out any numbers.  Another 5 mins went by and WE were wondering if that was our order but it was missing the pizza.  A full 25 mins went by before the staffer that took our order also gave us the same bag (that was sitting there) with the pizza.  We left, the pizza was warm/hot but not the chicken or the fries by the time we got home.  We had to re-heat both.  This must be something the kitchen hasn't figured out the timing when a pizza is order with other food.  I was there with a group of friends during opening night and 2 pizzas were order, they came out about 20 minutes AFTER the rest of the table received their food.  While I can excuse this happening on open night because it was crazy busy, it's 4 months later and the kitchen logistics should've worked out all the kinks.     Why didn't we go back--we were too tired that night.    Two things that annoyed me: 1.  It  wasn't busy and the none of the 2-3 staffers hanging around the ice machine took the initiative to ask the kitchen WHEN the pizza was going to be ready or thought to return the rest of the order back to the kitchen because it would be cold.  2.  If the kitchen knows it takes the 20-25 minutes for the pizza, why would  the rest of the kitchen fill the rest of the order and have it sit on the counter getting cold and soggy?  I hope the managers fixes this problem. The cookie was great, though.

hCBCXwykP7tFVIa87l0Huw.text: The food was yummy and the restaurant seems very clean and well-organized. There isn't a hostess to sit you at a table, and there is no server to take your order, which I'm not a huge fan of. You go up to the counter to give them your order and a server brings it to you. There is a great bar and the employees are very nice. I would go back again.

XmpheEMvhkIRb4Q-xc5AmQ.text: Finally tried this place. Stopped by for a quick breakfast, ordered the breakfast burrito to go. Thought it was a bit pricey, but it was the most portable- looking breakfast on the menu.   When I opened the box, I was surprised that the tortilla looked oily. It must have been warmed with oil on the grill. It was so oily that it was dripping out of the bottom. The insides were tasty, but I skipped the tortilla.   I will say the coffee was excellent!

3l9woRmLWjIqb5yKxkFu-w.text: I wanted to love this place, but I just can't.   The good: atmosphere, outside seating, dog friendly, great customer service.   The bad: pizza is not good. It's just a thick dough bread- like bad microwave pan pizza. I thought this place was a bit healthier and would have thin crispy pizza. We also had a burger which was okay. Lastly, had two draft chardonnay- disgusting. My head will hurt if I describe it further.

V7sKNniT9Z8KsCQNxqudjQ.text: Update. I went back and had the chicken sandwich and It was AWESOME!  It was good. But not special. I was hoping for more  I probably should have gotten the chicken sandwich. There were like 6 sitting in the pick up window. But no, I had to ask the lady taking my order what she thought was better. Anyways, the pot pie is good, mine wasn't hot and flaky, and the filling is a green Chile base that I normally like, but I found myself missing the creamy gravy like sauce of a traditional pot pie.  Also had the Cuban sandwich which was average, and the cheese pizza for my kid. It was also average.

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

A4W6vUOvUONDm72Tc2QWhg.text: Stumbled across this place yesterday after work, decided to try some food. Pizza was pretty good. Atmosphere is amazing all of their food is locally sourced. I came back this morning to try their coffee bar, WOW! Absolutely delicious! Staff was super friendly, latte was far less $$$ than some of those chain spots. Coffee is also local from Tucson. Check this spot out, you won't be disappointed.

7XKT8PSBcjFcmpPpVwwSIw.text: Went for lunch last Thursday and was looking forward to one of their signature dishes,  Chile stew Pot pie. To me, it was underwhelming at best. I just don't get it. Seems like everything these days needs to be "NUEVO-FUSION" what have you, just to be different, rather than what Chile was originally intended to be. Why should green Chile be laden with Cumin, or other misplaced spices? Also, the pie was far from flaky and moist, and was probably sitting around. Tortillas and Mexican Coca Cola was good.

_6dV1pPDiiyP9R-tbyiYyg.text: We just had a fantastic graduation party for my grandson here! Food and service impeccable and can't say enough about Sarah and Ken and the service...thank you!

b6HET6-xmyyMGRa45E0fAA.text: I love this place!!! The food is good and Garrett is an amazing bartender..  I would highly recommend this restaurant.

lX3uhQ-Y3zJNRb8Lz9YByA.text: I really want to like this place. I've been there probably 5 times. Every time I wonder why I'm there. When the weather is nice, the outdoor bar seating is nice. The inside seating just feels too casual for what you'd sort of expect for a place with a nice bar.  The bartenders are a bit inattentive. I've sat at the bar for over 10 minutes waiting to order. More than once. I'm patient but they make me feel a bit invisible as they rush around and wait on others around me. On my first visit I got very excited as parts of Tempe Public Market somewhat resembles Windsor. Unfortunately the menu is much simpler and it's nothing like Windsor. The quiche is pretty good, not great but ok. Other than that I've only had a Caesar salad. There just isn't much on the menu that I'd want to eat. I was hoping they'd expand the menu once they were opened for a bit but so far that hasn't happened. Dear Tempe Public Market - please expand your menu and cocktail list! You need more appetizer options.  also, not that this is a bad thing - but this really seems to be more of a family oriented restaurant. There are a lot of kids on the patio area. For me, I just prefer a more relaxing atmosphere without kids running around - although I'd fully deal with this if there were better food options and friendlier bartenders.

0uegglJ-_NS6exYM94AVZQ.text: So had the fried chicken sandwich with fries, a cookie, a soda and a coffee to go. The food was very good but would say slightly overpriced. An add-on of fries or a salad should not be $4 when just the sandwich costs 10.50, $2 would be more appropriate, but whatever.  Also, the flies are ridiculous. They are flying all over the food and desserts. I don't know what can be done about it but it's gross man.   The seating in this place is nearly communal. Half inside and half outside. What the heck are they going to do in the summer? They will lose half of their seating as there is no way anyone can sit outside, especially with the poor overhead coverage.  Parking overall is poor as it's limited. It's going to get worse when Ghost Ranch opens next door.

6nMkc_ARGa4gztCmBp11uw.text: Amazing, fresh, and local food! One of my favorite places in the valley! Awesome happy hour too!

PUn3A3WbdiQRGj-EPMVAKg.text: Somehow my original review was taken down because I was supposedly not actually at the restaurant.  This place....the drinks are overpriced and weak. The wine is expensive too. The food that we had , pretzels and hot wings, had terrible sauces! No waitress service makes this place a no go.

E_KTxWoNzxY8PBwmUwS9tA.text: Had lunch here and had the Tito's Cubano. It was really good. The bred they use is sooo good. The service was great and the music they play was music on my playlist. I would definitely come back here.

bcfg1Y7TuNFRRdW3AymB2A.text: Long line to order & only one cashier. I know they just opened (two weeks ago) but they probably should've staffed accordingly to handle dinner rush. Looked last le the manager was under an incredible amount of stress & when we went to get our drinks the ice maker was out of ice & the iced tea container was empty. I was really hoping the food would make up for the LONG wait but unfortunately, food was just okay. I think I'll take my $80 & go somewhere else. Maybe wait a few weeks until service & food are improved.

-5s3o1unUE7lTfXcyEAkxQ.text: I love giving good reviews and mentioning people by name, but this place does not afford me that opportunity...I met a few old friend for lunch here today and we were REALLY disappointed! The line took 45 minutes to get through, and then our food took another 30 minutes to get to the table. When the kids cheeseburger and the adult grilled cheese that we ordered came to our table, they were cold and both looked like kids plates. I asked the server if this was the adult grilled cheese or the kids grilled cheese and he responded "they're the exact same". For the price difference, I feel like the adult grilled cheese should be bigger and better than the kids right?! It really was a sub par grilled cheese too. I could've saved myself $12 and made one at home. They only had one option for ice tea during the lunch rush, and no one had any idea if a kids meal included a drink. I had to go through three employees before I got an answer and they weren't even confident that it did. There are a lot of options for lunch in the area, I will not be returning!

qsm7CaI_Ux2fnBba240DvA.text: Great Outdoor bar and seating area, atmosphere is excellent. Happy hour pricing seemed a little erratic. Food ok, but they are still getting up and going. They had A LOT of business and seemed overwhelmed- guy next to me had to prompt waitress about a chicken sandwich and he was there before us and we were served before him. We took one look at the register line and grabbed two seats at the bar to avoid the crowd.

bnm53DCgQgESbqIifTerGA.text: Came the first week of opening. We were glad to sit at the bar, given the flow of people. We had breakfast. It was incredible. Handmade bagels made to perfection. Modest but filling portions. Exceptional Bloody Mary made by bartender. Favorite local breweries on draft. All beautiful and locally source veggies. Wonderfully balanced menu.

j2i51Bd6d9UvjtUQqVwk8w.text: Looked forward to a new place close to home but disappointed. Nice venue but fear it would be unpleasant during hotter months as it is fully open. Outside tables are facing the wrong direction so sun was directly in your face. Tried to order a decaf coffee but they don't have it. Who doesn't serve decaf options these days? Ordered the frittata which was tasty but definitely not a frittata- an open omelet with the filling on top. Got a coupon for a free pop tart which was appreciated but the girl tried to serve one which was burnt but did replace it when I asked. Server was helpful to start getting us water and utensils. Friend's coffee was slopped into saucer. Glad we asked for real cups otherwise you get a paper cup, appears no refills. I know we sat a long time talking but got the distinct feeling from the server that he wanted us to move on. I doubt I will be back, sorry, it was not inspiring.

1swcl76-kjCDmsdMWxHzdA.text: Beautiful new cafe. I got the chicken sandwich and fries. Sat outside for lunch in January. Doesn't get much better than this! A little pricey for lunch but comparable with the type of food and location. I'll be back for sure.

4kneukVjPFGuLMzvLCP_Qw.text: Went there today for breakfast around 9am.  The place was about 30% occupied.   Great - no lines.   Ordered a simple breakfast item with eggs and potatoes.  Took more than 20 minutes to get served!!!  Food tasted bland and boring.  No flavor.  Lesson learned.  Next time I'll go to Wildflower or Panera.

2egL6huW4vkrMmk7cEICcg.text: We went to Tempe Public Market Cafe for the first time today for breakfast and I couldn't have been more impressed. All ingredients are local and fresh, and it really resonates with the amazing taste of their dishes. The service was top notch, as was the atmosphere and overall allure of the cafe.

SqxwFZQej0pfWFGQhyAsoA.text: This was our first visit and I was very excited to try this new fabulous looking place. The line wasn't too long but still took a while since the people in front of us could not make up their mind and there was only one of the two registers open on a Saturday night. I ordered the pot pie which was delicious and a side of crispy sweet potatoes. When they delivered our food they brought me a baked sweet potato.   I told him I ordered the crispy potatoes and he said that's what this is.  I know what a baked potato looks like, a little more training is needed here apparently.  I made him take it back to get the crispy sweet potatoes and he brought the baked potato back stating they don't serve crispy sweet potatoes at night. What! Then why is it on the menu and why did that gal at the register not tell me that?  My husband ordered the superfood salad with chicken and of course it came out with no chicken and very small.  Also it is a little expensive for the area. Great happy hour prices though, we might be back for happy hour but not for dinner.

NIJkqyOWMoLWF_YLSm0RMQ.text: I loved that cafe it was amazing customer service was amazing fast service I was seriously amazed in how fast and good quality they had

_twhzx1fz6RHfZwVkO9JJg.text: Their food is great. I love everything I have tried and the service is always wonderful. The wait isn't as bad anymore and they are very fast about getting you in and seated even when the wait looks long. Definitely worth it and a great try.

RzK3jriQTHkklYwcCpG9kg.text: Been here a few times, but the food quality has been inconsistent. I finally got my husband to try this place, which is within walking distance of our house.  He is not a fan. The food on this last visit was really underwhelming and not what I had experienced before.  Both the pizza and the nachos were both lacking cheese, as if the kitchen was running really low and rationing what they had.  The nachos consisted of a huge plate of chips with black beans dumped in a pile the middle and a small bit of guac and diced tomato.  On a previous visit they had more generous toppings, including cheese.  Overall a nice place to hang with friends but in my opinion the food does not warrant the high prices. The employees were all very friendly.

VT6XLEZQV8A9vm54KpIN7A.text: Not safe for Celiacs!  Having Celiac Disease I have to be careful about where I eat out.  Seeing lots of identified gluten free choices on the online menu I thought I could give it a try.  We took several gals there for my sister's birthday.  As we finally got through the line to order (and this took a LONG time) the manager informed us that the identified gluten free nachos (and fries) were fried in oil that other gluten containing food was also fried in.  Therefore they were cross contaminated.  I thought this was very short sighted menu labeling.  I told him whenever I see a fried food labeled gluten free I assume it is fried in a dedicated fryer.  As I tried to choose another gluten free meal the manager expressed concern that they do pizzas and have flour flying in the air and that the lines are very prone to cross-contamination.  We talk it through and I decided to try the chicken and mashed potato dish (labeled at gluten free).  He gave specific instructions to the kitchen to be careful when preparing.  It was very tasty but alas, I awoke in the night to a stomach ache and some nausea and have had some issues this morning.  If I had to guess, I'd say I was glutened.  They definitely need to revamp the menu, removing some gluten free labels and adding the obligatory "eat at your own risk" statements saying they have heavily glutened food prep area.  I will definitely not be eating here again (which is sad as the environment is great and the Prickly Pear Tea is fabulous).  Thankfully Picasso's is up the road and offers a totally safe eating experience.    All that said, I have to say the manager was extremely kind and concerned about getting things right.  I fully realize that I took a risk eating there and do not fault them for my getting sick...I understood the situation and decided to do it anyway.  The manager comped the difference between the nachos and chicken dinner and really tried to help me out.  But I did want to inform other Celiacs or those with bad gluten allergies that this is not the place for you.  I trust that the management will also get more serious about having their menu reflect that they are not safe for such people.

xetsBC8tbMh7cAA4sLEtJQ.text: Had roasted salmon dish and it was delish. Was not prepared for an order then seat yourself style, so waiting about 15 minutes to order (on a busy night). Food was served at different times, my food came out when my table was half way done with their food. So one draw back. Overall, nice staff, good fresh food. Prepared for ordering style for next time.

w4rTqXHY-OaSMNGFOvnSSA.text: I used to go to the Phoenix public market all the time so I was excited when Tempe was opening. I was more than disappointed with my experience. The chicken sandwich was cold, hard, and tasted like it was sitting out for 20 minutes. My mom's chicken salad sandwich had bones in it and she chipped a tooth when she bit into it. There was no service at all besides a few bussers walking around. Just a giant line you have to stand in just to order your food and for the price that is ridicoulous. I even had to get my own drinks. The ice machine was out and they had a little bucket with a little scoop to scoop your own ice. Thats very unsanitary. When we told the staff about what happened, they simply said "sorry that happened and I will tell the chef to look for the bones next time." Really?? Good drink deals but I can not see myself spending money here again.

RSB6x74BxLI09z4L4hgdOg.text: WORST RESTAURANT EVER! Horrible service. always such a long wait and never have enough people working there. Out of everything, unprepared. We just canceled our order because we couldn't take it, and what would happen next. I honestly think they need to close and re-open when they are ready and prepared to actually handle a restaurant. Definitely do NOT recommend.

f8qNOJkc91ffNsIDc03C4Q.text: Food was OK...... but the employees seem much more interested in socializing with each other rather than assisting customers.  We returned an item to be heated up and 20-25 minutes later it still did not return.  We asked one of the waitstaff to check on it, and she seemed indifferent to help us.  Overall, very bad customer service.

QTrYZa9Q8qtGBMY4f0D7uw.text: Me and a coworker went on Tuesday and really liked the ambiance of the place.  They did an excellent job on the building and the strip center should be drawing quite the crowds now, only worries are the parking in the future.  As for the food we both enjoyed our meals and definitely will be coming back, most likely tomorrow.  I look forward to the addition of their rotisserie chicken in the future.  Anyway, I will try and snap some pics tomorrow.

c8BqUEyytyejBllfNXobPA.text: Excited there is a new place I can bike too for happy hour...patio is beautiful.. however serious staff and management issues... long waits.... unengaged bar tenders...sat down today at bar...2 other people there and after 8 minutes had to wave down bartender 3 feet from me... also, I watched so much wasted beer on the pours...they are literally pouring out half glass of foam... John taferter would have a stroke watching them!  Patio is dog friendly... I will give them a third try with hopes that they can get it together

DHlw_4gO97oP1PTMtUC0GA.text: I was pretty excited to try this place but, was really disappointed.  We stopped in for breakfast and there weren't many choices and everything came with potatoes and / or toast.  No options for those who don't want a carby meal.  Yes, I know you can order it without bread and potatoes but, you have to pay for them anyway so it would be nice to have at least one option for those who don't eat all the heavy carbs.  I ordered the Devils Mess (without the tortilla) and despite the fact that it had chorizo, chilis and salsa, it was really lacking flavor.  It had heat, don't get me wrong, but heat doesn't equal flavor.  Plus, mine was supposed to come with spinach and I only had 3 leaves of spinach.  Overall it was bland.  It really could have used some cheese or sour cream to cut the heat.  My daughter had the breakfast burrito and again just thought it was meh.  Not much flavor, large pockets of cheese that wasn't evenly distributed throughout the burrito.  The coffee was ok.  It was towards the end of the self serve carafe so it wasn't as warm as it should have been.  I think the food was was too expensive for what you got - $27 for two for breakfast that was just so so is too much for me.  And, it's seriously loud in the restaurant.  We ate inside - not sure if outside was quieter but, inside, we could barely talk to each other it was so loud.  Probably won't be back.

f1PlNgAp2hoD5CY2vg35fg.text: We've been anxiously awaiting TPM to open for over a year now, as we love the Phoenix location and constantly go out of our way for meals at St. Francis. To have that caliber of restaurant within walking distance would be great, right?! If it weren't for the name, you would never guess this place has anything in common with the other two. We've gone for breakfast twice now, and walked away extremely disappointed both times. We've never had to battle the long lines everyone else mentions, so this review is just on the layout and food. Our service there has actually been ok, as well. First, let people know that they need to grab silverware and water themselves, regardless of where they're sitting. It seems minor, but literally every person can be heard muttering under their breath at that counter that they should have been told to do it in the first place. Second: what genius decided to stick the coffee right in the corner of the front entrance, right where the most packed location in the entire restaurant is? There's never room to maneuver to get coffee, and the waiters never seem to see if it needs to be refilled. I've had to flag down a waiter on each visit to let them know they were out. Third: flies. Seriously, figure it out already. It was bad on the first visit, and worse on the 2nd. Multiple other reviews list the same thing- we actually moved outside the second visit to escape the flies. Fourth: the breakfast menu had no imagination or execution. Some things were good, like the biscuits and gravy and the corn cake, but not near worth the prices charged. The rest of the menu is unbelievably bland. When you have 2 kids push away their food and ask if we can go somewhere else like Oink, First Watch or Crepe Bar, you have serious problems. You simply can't justify the prices with the food being put out. We'll probably give it another try because it's so new, but to say we're disappointed is an understatement.

fil_CKMiOW0lAfw8hQYJQw.text: Had the Rooster Booster breakfast with eggs over-easy.  It was decent, but last Friday I had breakfast at another local restaurant, same items but everything there was better.

Mla74WgGb-B9AEfQn0vTHQ.text: Nothing special here, except for the high prices.  Too expensive for fast-food, and too low-quality for slow-food.  Service is definitely slow, very slow.  With Panera, Wildflower, Hillside, Tilted Kilt and a few other other better places nearby,  this is one gets added to the "skip" category.

vm9IALIyxBFoJICDMq95CQ.text: Good food, great ambiance (if you can find a place to sit outdoors), but a little pricy.

YP_bFXyu1SGDxyvVfNpijA.text: Came here on Friday night for the first time. The place was done really well. The patio is awesome. The major flaw with this place is the service style. You order at the counter and tables are first come first serve. This posses many problems. First off people are lurking everywhere to snag the first table that opens up. It is wierd to have people just standing around trolling for your table. The next issue is good luck getting anything else for you table such as dessert or drinks. You have to go stand in line at the bar to get drinks. No service at the tables. This format would be great for lunch, but for dinner they really need to switch to the traditional host/server model. The food was good. Pizza was just ok. Kids cheeseburger came with no cheese. Good luck getting mayo or mustard. The fried chicken was really good. The best I have had in a while. We will give this place another chance just for the patio and fried chicken.
