3gah32gY_Z5j5cUqT0QIrw.text: The highly anticipated opening of Tempe Public Market has occurred and the green restaurant staff are serving the hordes of hungry patrons. Guests order at the counter, take a table top number, and wait for the food to arrive. All six in our party were happy with the result. There is also a bar for alcoholic drinks and happy hour every day. The non-alcoholic drinks are selected in line, other than water and the iced teas. The Sun Devil fries are good for sharing. For the most part, the food is comfort food with some healthy ingredients to enable you to feel good about yourself. The sangria had a cinnamon taste, perfect for the warm winter weather. We'll be back.

jCQTpWWbm6kh9mNVNld9PQ.text: Let me start with the positive, the food was ok, hence the two stars but the whole experience deserves 1 Star. I had to wait over a half hour to order food. There was only one cashier and like 10 people standing behind her on the food line. There was also one other person drying silverware but no other cashiers. My friend and I ordered separately to save a table so between my half hour and her half hour to wait in line, we didn't eat for an hour. By the time we could sit down together her food was sitting there while she waited for me to get my food. She ordered a bowl of soup that was literally gone in 4 bites. I thought she had already starting eating when I sat down but no it was just the smallest bowl of soup--not a cup of soup. My salad had a dressing on the side  that I think equaled a tablespoon. All in all we were both disappointed and agreed it was a terrible experience!

YHYc70Z7J_Dmr2QVXSKuzg.text: Big crowds for opening weekend for this "underserved" community, but soups, salads, burgers, pizza, sandwiches, sangria all worth the wait for this group! Staff is very attentive. Manager stopped by to say hi and thanks us for our patience, but we are just grateful for good food in South Tempe!

py6psomIZrzjJRNB4bO0PQ.text: This is a great addition to the neighborhood and amazed at the size inside and out! Great ambiance and food!  My friend and I both ordered their crispy chicken sandwich.  We loved our meals and the service.  In addition, we ordered their coffee lattes which were great as well.  Overall excellent venue and will definitely go again!

d1IcgG1CDhmsI6SAPIGmtA.text: Tonight this place must have been understaffed. After being ignored for long periods of time we attempted to close our tab at the bar we asked the busser to close our tab because the bartender was too busy hitting on girls to help us out. In order to speed the process up we tried to give the busser a credit card to pay instead of getting the bill first. He walked over to the register and day we couldn't give him the card. So I said "Hey bud!" to get his attention. Surprisingly, this was the first time all night the bartender looked over to us. He had some look of annoyance in his face when he heard me. The bartender asked me if I was talking to him or the busser. Obviously, I was talking to the busser because that was the only person helping me at all. Then the bartender asked me how old I am and then he told me that he was 28. I'm not sure why, and I can't keep up with all the things that offend the worst generation in history, but then he had the God damn audacity to tell me I was rude. I said ok because I'm not going to argue with am underachieving 28 year old bartender. I'm sure when calling someone "Bud" started bothering the snowflakes but I don't give a shit. I hope they fire that bartender and I'll make sure to visit again to have a follow up with the worst bartender in the country.

AoLzloEg46TUZWxio3rTEw.text: Food is delish! Service is even better!!  Part of our order was missed by accident. So, one Edson at the table was eating while the other wasn't behest addressed, the manager was amazing. Comped the one dish and brought us a dessert to share in the mean time. Class act. I will be back and refer everyone here!!!

hVHfF0klS1xJu_bQ1312Yw.text: I have been to this location twice for lunch. Each time I was greeted warmly.  On both times the service was exceptional, better than most. The food always came out quickly. First time I had the rice bowl and then today I had the Eat the Rainbow salad.  Both amazingly fresh and tasty. I am so happy to be able to write a happy review! I love this place.

zBsUJK-vSqL7fxsQ4o2AnA.text: The Tempe Public Market has an amazing atmosphere! Great music and an open air concept that has a stand alone fire place with multiple fire pits around an amazing patio area. The menu is diverse and extremely fresh. I had the AZ burger and it was great! My colleagues had the chicken sandwich and the brick pressed chicken and they were both pleased!

aBI4lOtDq00sdSBpN8ltqg.text: I love this is awesome love the food and the atmosphere is the best! Highly recommend the chorizo biscuits and gray!!

6vYr6e024TYtt4vHupXoKA.text: It was okay.  We went around 5:30 on a Saturday night and they were out of all their food other than pizza.  (How does that happen?!?!)  Thankfully, there wasn't a line, so we ordered two pizzas and two glasses of wine and sat down. The wine came out right away, but the pizzas took more than 45 minutes.  We were starving by the time they came out, so I feel like anything edible would have been outstanding at that point.  Even still, the pizzas were just okay.  Nothing special.  All in all, the experience wasn't good.  It wasn't terrible, but I'm certainly not in a hurry to get back.

ArTbhHsAWBuGfLfvjO8suQ.text: I love this place. I've been here several times and I'm never disappointed. The patio is great, food is really good and love the coffee!

rAKCmzD-hQMXkr8ME1WKGA.text: Beautiful restaurant! South Tempe really needed a place like this!   I go for the dog friendly patio, smiling gracious staff, and Lee Travino cocktail.... It's like a spicy boozy Arnold Palmer. Sooo good!   Some food favorites of mine are the pan pizzas, look for the market specials they run with local produce and the crispy chicken sandwich with honey dill dijon sauce.   I also love that my kids and I can come in and they serve breakfast until 3 pm.   Overall great new place with friendly staff and good food!  A must visit if you live nearby.

aMO_fH3b3Gss9fCbfEfWnw.text: I ordered the frittata with crispy potatoes. Certainly was not impressed with the service from the counter. One of the bartenders was attentive and friendly. Underwhelmed by the food :/. However, my vanilla latte was heavenly.

UP1KQ3QizWZMuWfGEmpM9A.text: We had genuinely hoped that this place would be good as it is within walking distance from our home.  Unfortunately, there was nothing but disappointment.  We were greeted upon arrival and were told that the outdoor seating was open, so we grabbed a table (we were there a bit before the crowds that came later).  What they failed to tell us was that you had to go to the bar to order your drinks.  The 'wait' staff that was milling about outside was not able to take any orders.    When I went to the bar to order my drinks, it was quite the wait (remember that I was there early).  I ordered our drinks, but when I wanted to place a food order, I was informed that I had to go inside, to the counter that was 5 feet from where I was standing, to place the food order.  Again, a line.    In all, I spent roughly 15-20 minutes away from the folks I was there with, simply trying to place an order.    I had to repeat this process every time we needed refills on our drinks.  I also had to repeat this process again when we were ready to go and I needed to close out my tab.  In all, we were there about 2 hours and about half of that was spent standing in line.  This is not a good set up for a casual evening out with friends.  Go elsewhere unless they change their process.  I talked with several people in line that were equally frustrated with the set up.  If they wish to keep this set up, then they need to at least have someone greet you that explains their processes as it is not entirely clear.

AV8nCD07Qp7yVhXpne8-BA.text: We really enjoy their atmosphere and happy hour. The bartenders have sometimes seemed annoyed when you come up to order a drink, though that may be because they are always busy!

VOkvP-PZVRkyqHiXroDhPQ.text: We arrived around 11am today, and got greeted, handed menus, and waters immediately.  I thought to myself, "this is the day I'm updating my review to 5 stars!"  WRONG.  30 minutes after ordering, I ask the bartender to please check on our food.  Turns out our food wasn't rung in.  The bartender was VERY nice and apologetic, calls his manager over and she comes to ask me if I want a drink.  No thank you, I'm on a strict diet.  At this point, I'm still very nice and tell them it's no problem, we're not in a rush.  15 minutes go by, still no food.  20 minutes later, our food finally comes.  We grab our own silverware, and begin.  My usual (frittata) is very mediocre this time around.  My toast is toasted on one side, complete wet mush on the other..was it frozen? I'm not sure.  I ask for different toast.  Fiance starts to eat, tortilla is raw.  I ask for a different tortilla.  Manager comes over and laughs it off, "oh let's see how many times we can f*ck up today" and throws the tortilla across the bar to the trash bin.  We keep getting asked if we want pastries, I really appreciate the offer but I say no..I'm on a diet.   We got the bill and it looks like they comped a beer off.  As a fellow restaurant owner, I'd recommend investing in some training. We definitely won't be back for awhile, if ever, at this rate.  Too bad, because we usually drive 20 minutes out of our way to come here just about every weekend.

F33KzVWrbDNAhC0_JX4LqA.text: I've been a semi-regular at this place since they opened in Tempe. Based on previous visits, I would have given 3 1/2 to 4 stars. The positives -- The Devil's Mess breakfast scramble, the breakfast burrito and the fried chicken sandwich were all very good on my previous visits.  But today's lunch visit was a failure from start to finish, and leaves he wondering how soon I want to return. There were three of us in our party. Meal #1 arrived in time, but then it was five more minutes until meal #2 arrived. That order was delivered by what appeared to be a manager who asked if we were expecting one more meal. We said yes, of course, but that was the last we saw of her.   Finally, my AZ Burger showed up ten minutes later but without the accompanying fries. The server said the fries were still in the fryer and would be out soon. Another five minutes passed before my fries showed up.   I would have accepted this service issue as a one-time blip, but the food wasn't up to par today. The burger was cooked beyond the Medium that I ordered it, with that kind of stale taste as if the patty had been sitting around waiting to be assembled. The fries were a bit of a mess, with a lot of small bits from the bottom of the fryer basket.   At this point I just ate what I had instead of complaining since the rest of my party was already well through their meals. I would have had to find someone to complain to since no one from the staff ever came by our table again. The staff, including the manager on duty, all seemed to be enjoying their time socializing with each other but that means they were ignoring the customers.   After my first few visits to Tempe Public Market, I was excited to have a place like this in the neighborhood. But now they may have seen the last of me.

6njouleHBLCvNNCdTnmIFg.text: Wow.  And not a good kind of wow.   Ordered a pretzel with cheese as an appetizer. Came out after the meal. The appetizer pretzel wAs not needed after the meal.  We sent it back.  The waiter/ manager was stunned. Why would you send back an appetizer after it arrived after you started the meal?  I am obviously missing a subtlety in food ordering in Tempe.   No "I'm sorry", no apologies re: timing.  Just a sad explanation that they are re-launching in June to remedy these issues. Assistant GM had no apologies - just excuses.   I worked in restaurant business for many years. At a minimum, you offer dessert or drink as a token. I had to ask (because he clearly was not interested in offering) for either the pretzel in a to go box, or a refund. He finally relented with a gift card  Recommendations:   Be very specific with ordering.  Quality was good, but disappointing service (no utensils, no side plates for chips and salsa). Had to request and, after no response for 10 min, get them myself.  Maybe I should get some of the tips...  A bit overpriced for that level of service. But good food. Hopefully will turn it around. Maybe lots of the $2.50 happy hour beer will help!

Wye-fNMV4eNYcLK7l5X11w.text: Checked out Tempe Public Market today with a few girlfriends for our monthly mommy brunch. They have happy hour everyday which is nice. Large patio area and a decent amount of seating inside. They don't have a very extensive menu. I tried the AZ Burger (+ avocado) which was delicious! We also enjoyed a mimosa or three.

9Y4Ho9LjbUtHDbUEqNfISQ.text: Great local spot. Outdoor patio with heaters and such for night time gatherings. Food extremely fresh and prepared for you. You have to order in the cue, but they deliver. Beverages are self serve too. Interested to try night life here .  Breakfast crowd not lively ~~ parking easy.

L93G1cJCEFGYY87qQFGAwg.text: I have had some great meals here, like their kids pizza, cheeseburger and breakfast burrito, but this grilled cheese was ridiculous. When I ordered it was eight dollars, and after I said looks like the grilled cheese for kids is $3- whats the difference? The cashier said nothing, I asked if I can order that instead if there's no difference and she said next time and laughed. After I got the very generic sandwichas you can see in the picture its pretty boring, the cheese tasted old, the bread had no flavor and the watermelon was warm. I highly suggest not ordering this in the future.

5SfWYjW68JQvhMxZrB2x2Q.text: I love having the market cafe in Tempe.  There's good seating, food and beverages.  This is great for groups or for smaller numbers.  Come eat and be merry.

NRc8ynYenBc-IoBcLsy--g.text: Meh. Just okay.  Went in for a late breakfast ordered the basic eggs + bacon + potatoes w/toast.  Fiance got a spicy scramble dish that he said was just a tad too spicy.  You order at a counter and take a number.  Our dishes were each $10 and the portions didn't make me feel like I got my money's worth.  Small portions.  Breakfast is my favorite meal and I hardly get to enjoy it since I am on the go Monday through Friday with work and only get to make a shake.  This is not a breakfast as a treat type of place.   Nice patio and we took the dog. Maybe their lunch options are better?

lSYQZ4bXYjiqIrnC6regWg.text: I am a fan of the Phoenix Public Market Cafe and was super thrilled to have Tempe Public Market Cafe in my area to add to my lunch time eats!  January was a rough month for Tempe Public Market and I, since its newly opened there has always been a crazy line, I did try to get their lunch twice and had to bail both times since I am on a timed lunch on the 3rd try I got their and there was no line! 3rd times a charm, right?  I arrived about 10 minutes before 11am and didn't realize I could only order off the breakfast menu, but I was asked what I was interested in and told them and was told that they could make that happen!   I ordered the rice & beans bowl, it had black beans, brown rice, avocado, feta cheese, house made salsa and cilantro, this was a great tasting bowl and just what I was craving!  I am sure Tempe Public Market Cafe and I will become fast friends!

B0iS0DcmCahzr7HXTdiLeg.text: I like the fact that this bussiness   attracted people and other businesses to open close to them. The food is good. But not excellent.  I think that the bar and the mimosas are good. I wish they had more options on the menu. You don't have to wait that long to get your food.

T6XBgfgEPNHPvOYrCw0l_Q.text: Food very good, atmosphere great... HOWEVER the music is VERY loud and the management does not care. The table next to me got the very same answer when we asked again a second time to please lower the volume and they said "we already did" we asked them to lower it more and management refused. Good luck with your lack of pleasing customers. If I wanted a "club" I'd go find one, I will not be returning

BquRlHg3ERMyuB6lJuVh4A.text: I've been going to this cafe for about a year now. They recently did an entire renovation which I was really excited about. I came in and at first glance it looks like a super artistic hipster cafe. Super cute! I sat down and was greeted by the staff. I wasn't super in the mood for a meal so I decided to try their pastries and I ordered a slice of their cherry and tequila caramel cheesecake. Wow. I must say I was completely blown away. The texture and consistency of the cheesecake was exactly the way I have always wanted to enjoy a cheesecake. I was so excited and for all the cheesecake fanatics ( we all know how happy a velvety slice of cheesecake can make us) . It wasn't heavy it was simply delicious. After I paid I walked over to their pastry case and I actually bumped into the pastry chef. I believe he told me his name was LT. I decided to tell him how happy that slice of cheesecake made me and then he proceeded to give me some recommendations from his pastry case. He was so sweet and we actually talked a little bit about The cafe. I ended up taking some cookies  home and to be honest I'd probably keep coming back to try everything in that case, I'm eyeing that chocolate cake. I can't wait to go back. It's quite refreshing to find a local cafe that serves exceptional little pastries.

y3nlA14pNEZr7CYVT2mjJA.text: Delicious! I have eaten here a half dozen times and it is always sumptious. I especially love the flarney garney (did I spell that right?!), fries and the chicken sandwich. Yummmm! I also think the staff is exceptional, warm and accomodating. Neighborhood 'joint' for me, so I feel very lucky. Highly recommend

F4csIGYugA8wujgT1Csjew.text: Just stopped here today and the recent renovations are wonderful! My boyfriend and I came for Saturday morning brunch and each had a delicious meal served promptly even thought it was very busy. Service was attentive and friendly. The manager, Forbes, stopped by and introduced himself and recommended the house pretzels which were to die for. So happy to have this fun establishment near me!

VIPWenu7aGlm9mzI88Pmdw.text: I have been here three times in 6 months just for soft serve ice cream. All three times the machine was broken. This tells me the machine is broken more often than it works. I love soft serve and would like to offer my review on the quality of the soft serve here, but I have yet to taste it. My suggestion to the ownership would be to TAKE THE SOFT SERVE OFF THE MENU.  I am done with this place.

oZEXXadpdnamiM8YpxZmYA.text: The food is good with a pretty good selection of food.  Farm to table, local farms and growers.  The only problem is the ice cream- why are you always out of an ingredient on the normal menu?  No peanuts then no peanut sauce, the only ice cream on the menu.  Seems easy enough, right.  The steak was a little tough and over cooked tonight but usually spot on.  Beers were great-Pedal Haus IPA.  Patio is awesome.  Step up your game for these prices, the kids menu is the best value for sure!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tempe Public Market Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pedal Haus deuce

w-w0H_eY9xFgNzGJfkph-g.text: I tried this place maybe 15 times & really wanted to like it.  I love the atmosphere.  I eat out a lot and travel internationally or out of state about 25% of my time, so have a lot of dining experience to compare with the food they serve here.  But the food is always mediocre & prices high for what you get.  I've tried many of the items but never really got excited about any of them.  I do love the Ghost Ranch next door that apparently the same owners started, but can't figure out why they can't create good food here.   Great place to hang out if you just want a beer.

5KWsvKaxVT-7V7RGue51PA.text: As usual, great service and food start to finish! Especially loving the new look of the place and evening table service! Our server, Jackie, was so friendly and helpful. She got our child's order in and out so quickly. Great conversation, great attitude and a poppin' manicure! Keep up the great work TPM!

ypas4oYIu0UaGzNXVdGfWg.text: Layla was awesome, friendly and efficient! Food was yummy...those damn pretzel bites are ridiculously good!

Xncrwhmw0rGuSNIbrTFjRQ.text: We went here on opening night, the food is alright, I don't know what the hype was about? It's like an open Panera that serves alcohol lol! b9bdtbY8hsWYFb_A3HzvAA.text: The food was delicious and our server Monroe was adorable. The Asuan Citrus salad was amazing

SPu8rDeZg5sPY6GG-KRUkQ.text: We have a very "Up & Down" relationship with Tempe Public Market Cafe. We always loved the community-type feel of the place that is directly referenced in the name..."Public Market Cafe". You order, find a seat and they bring you out your food. You can choose your table, re-fill your water, and just relax and have a good time with great food. It was unique and set it apart from other traditional restaurants. Our first visit was disastrous but the manager apologized, made some suggestions and we came back and it quickly became a favorite. Then all of the sudden, the menu changed and our favorite dishes were no longer there, or they changed too much. We kind of accepted this as the nature of the place.   We hadn't been in a while so we went this evening. Wow, everything changed! New decorations, new ambiance, new tables and chairs, new-ish menu and totally new ordering system. Now there's a hostess and seating and traditional wait staff. Ok I guess, but very different from what set it apart from other restaurants. So I guess that's gone, but at least the food will still be good.  8pm on a Saturday night is obviously busy and we understood that. We asked to be seated outside and we were. Unfortunately the table was underneath a leaky mister and we sat with our feet in a large puddle of water. Ok, no big deal. Then we waited. And waited. I was about to go up front just to tactfully ask how long we should be prepared to wait when a clearly frazzled young waitress came to take our drink order. She was about to dash away when my wife said "Oh, we're ready to order, we've been here long enough already". This may have frazzled her more. My wife ordered the appetizer and her falafel sandwich and I asked the waitress if the Garden Pizza had cheese. No cheese was listed but neither was it listed on any other pizza (except the cheese pizza) and I figured 'What's a pizza without cheese?' I think this frazzled our poor waitress even more but she finally said that, yes the pizza had cheese.  The rest of the meal was timely. We got our pretzel appetizer quickly but were disappointed to see that half of the pretzels were obviously burnt. Too bad because the ones that weren't burnt were very good with tasty dipping sauces.  Our meals come out and while my pizza looked delicious piled high with veggies...there was obviously no cheese. But there was no way I was going to say something to our waitress that might drive her over the edge. It was a decent meal, but it was not what I really wanted. I wanted a pizza...with cheese. It was good, but I would not order it again.   My wife loved her falafel sandwich and fries so at least there was that. I asked for a take-home box for the more-than half pizza left - which was already large. She came back with a little container that could not have held even one slice. Bypassing our waitress I went to the front and someone gave me an actual pizza box which was very welcome.  Not my intention but clearly someone said something to our waitress because she apologized for the box. No problem, we can just pay the bill. She came back, gave us the bill, cleared the dishes, ran the card and brought back the bill and left. I opened it ready to sign but there was no pen. Waitress was gone and we just softly laughed together. What a weird cap-off to an interesting night. Had to go to the front to find a pen.  Even though service was lacking, still left a good tip but I have reservations about coming back. Perhaps it is still a new system and the staff hasn't gotten used to it. Perhaps the waitress just had a bad night. My wife and I aren't demanding, dismissive or rude so I don't think it was us. Perhaps it was just bad timing.  I want to love this place and I want to encourage unique businesses, but the new change and the staff made it difficult this time.

eFAMTIsriCSz5z8IVVy9qQ.text: So happy they have opened a Public Market Cafe in Tempe!! Love going to Phoenix Public Market Cafe, but finally one that is closer to me with the same great affordable and locally sourced food as it's sister restaurants. A great place to hangout anytime/day of the week with a dog friendly patio! I got the Chorizo Biscuits and Gravy with Scrambled Eggs. My sister got the breakfast sandwich and my step mom had the Asian chicken salad. Plus the Sun Devil Fries that we all shared. Everything was amazing as expected and I cannot wait to come back and bring my friends! Don't forget to stop in for their Cinnamon Rolls (weekends only while supplies last) they are to die for!! But they have a bunch of other super delicious pastries for sale every day!

kVDCQcUVSPRaW7SjMd-eQQ.text: Went there during happy hour on Friday.  The food and drinks were delicious and well worth the price--the Lee Trevino is quite tasty.  The service was exceptional.  We sat at the bar and our primary bartender was Rico--he was excellent.  We will definitely be going back!

02a4RbPvmj666FrnDFEC1Q.text: I really want to like this place but I just can't. The place is always busy and I don't really understand why? My first visit we ordered a breakfast burrito and it was seriously lacking... especially for the price. It was just a burrito on a white plate. Definitely a lack of presentation but I figured it would probably be delicious. The burrito was extremely bland. No salsa or anything.  We decided to give this place a second shot. I ordered the AZ burger. Still not impressed. There's plenty of places in the area to get a burger and this place doesn't even compare.  I feel like this place is catered to the wrong demographic for the area. I'm in my 30s and I even found the music that they play extremely annoying. All I could think about was how I wanted to leave. The setup seemed like it was catered to those in their early 20s. Maybe it's great for some but this is not my type of place... which is a bummer because we live right down the street.

NPlJt7FHJG1FfGpHiI--fQ.text: Day drinking on the beach cruisers starts here.  Not a bad selection of beer, and fun craft cocktails. Bartender was witty and sarcastic (just how I like them) Hard to believe that this was a Circle K at one time.  We didn't eat much, my pretzel addict girlfriend had the pretzel and cheese. Nice patio for AZ fall and winter.......needs some live music on the patio!! Update......5th visit.   My favorite place in Tempe

EPbxFn8e9SXSmVkOkJjwAA.text: 5 star location for sure! I'm a frequent visitor to the area and absolutely loved their outdoor seating with the glorious misters keeping things cool. They have a large patio with a bar on the inside and outside and a fireplace for the cooler evenings.   As first timers it's a little bit odd. Luckily a lot of people seem confused when they walk in and the staff does a good job of finding us and bringing us a menu, huddling us up and giving us the scoop while we stand by the door. Note: you order up front and they bring everything after though it's not obvious when you walk in.   Food was pretty good. I had a bun less burger with guacamole and loved every bite. Once seated, the waitstaff brings you refills on drinks from the bar and constantly checks up.   We had a great time hanging out and chatting. Happy Hour runs to 6pm. With tips, 3 drinks a piece and entrees for all 5 we were under $150. Will definitely be back.

UZkoTuyzt08zWPzwoIREtQ.text: I've been several times before the renovation and once since then. I must say, I prefer the old menu and was disappointed in the changes made to the food. We also waited much longer for our food with the full service concept than we did when ordering at the counter. I hope they take some of the feedback and bring back the old favorites.

uua-yV14tqM-DtsnIt7eNA.text: This place is great! It really is a unique gem tucked into a quiet neighborhood. Just as the owner planned, it has become a center for families, casual chats and business meetings. The night I ended up here we were able to snag one of the last few tables outside to enjoy the cool Tempe evening, and by a fireplace. The vibe here is great, relaxed, friendly, and the food options are fantastic! We even just made the happy hour cut and jumped on the personal pizzas and nachos with $4 beer specials. I'll be back again :)

yKPHngH5wNA7xzK-SFy9Lg.text: Rico the Brit was the BEST!!!! My 2nd time here and it's because of him!!! Make sure you sit at the bar and ask for Rico cause his drinks are the bomb.

ydO_FgDAMx2d-aa0JCAnug.text: My go to spot for hanging out and having coffee on the weekdays.  Sadly the food is all quite bad here so we just stopped ordering. We tried about 8 different items and then just gave up and decided it will be a coffee spot.  1 Star for the food but 4 stars for ambiance. Averaging a 3.

eawXM663OpBwyJj6vwQvgA.text: Ordered the Flarney, goooooo grub!  Coffee is strong and the place is clean! Lots of staff, while they were friendly they were a little stand offish....  Would def come back!

596bAMU4f3Gym8Didh-hBQ.text: Still three stars. I have been back twice since my original review.   SIDE NOTE: I did not take the manager's gift card, BTW. I appreciate the offer but I don't write reviews to get free stuff. ;)  Second visit: Co-worker wanted to go there so I went. Busy but it's lunchtime and that is expected. I order the pizza and even though it is silly expensive at $14 for a cheese pizza with like 6 (maybe 8?) small pieces, it is amazing. I am ready to take back everything I said and bow to the Public Market gods.  Third visit: I crave the pizza so I go back a few days later. Another $14. That's fine. But this pizza has almost no cheese on it and is burned on the bottom. They are so busy that I can't find anyone to help me so I just eat a few pieces and toss it. I am over the obsession.

xMPMqwy4Z4wBF3_FiebnHA.text: Great for an outside meal or Happy hour. They also do special cookouts and fun events for a reasonable price. They have a wood fireplace and a gas one also heaters if needed. The summer has a massive mister system however no shade unfortunately. They do have indoor booths and a bar that is inside and outside to sit at. Everyone working there is very friendly and I love how they hire young high school kids as well as middle age.  Good for families, date night, work meetings, dog friendly, great food.

v7pS6UyseFdbKD37nKiUGg.text: I want to love this place, I really do. The vibe here is amazing - the outdoor seating area (which features tables and a bar) is really pretty and the sunset view is amazing. They have happy hour everyday until 7 (weekends included!) and some pretty good prices and options. I've come here twice now, each time wanting to love the food but it never quite hits the mark for me. Almost every dish I've tried has been from the happy hour menu (pizzas, pretzels/cheese, chips and guacamole/salsa) and they don't have much going on flavor wise. The cheese dip for the pretzels is watery and the pretzels didn't really taste quite like a good pretzel should. Overall, really average food and definitely not something I would crave or want to come back for. Maybe this is just the happy hour selections and something from the regular menu would be better. Drink wise, their lager was okay but I really enjoyed their house sangria. Giving this place 3 stars for the overall ambiance, friendly staff, and good happy hour selection. I would come back here for a drink at their outdoor bar before I'd come back for a meal.

hBIgIbiG9EUk69wK98eMZw.text: Awesome casual place with a spectacular dog friendly patio.  The food is really good with more options than most for vegan and vegetarians.  Staff have all been genuinely cool to me. It's become one of my wife and my favorite spots.

WaxRPqqmDzJ8XvdCgS5I3A.text: I was super impressed by this place! I live on the other side of town, but I was visiting a friend who lives in Tempe and she recommended we go here for dinner. They have indoor and outdoor seating, with a dog-friendly patio. We decided to sit outside because of the inviting fire pits and abundant heaters to keep us warm. You place your order at the counter and they bring it out to you. Their menu has codes for vegetarian, vegan, dairy-free, and gluten-free options which I really appreciate since I'm vegan. I was pleasantly surprised to see quite a few vegan options, including desserts which is a big plus in my book. I loved everything I had! The pizza was loaded with veggies and had plenty of red sauce. I'm not a huge fan of blueberries, but the vegan blueberry crumble bar I had was great. This place will definitely be at the top of my list when I'm on this side of town again!

qARs3C--_7OSrgZIwDT0kg.text: Don't you just hate it when a restaurant ruins your "go-to" meal??  The new remodel is nice, but they changed the food....   The food was Soooo goooood before the temporary close.   Very disappointed in the "new" Chinese chicken salad. The old one was WAY BETTER.  This one tastes like any other asain salad now.  Please bring back the Chino!   It was the only one like it, and it was PERFECT.    I am now afraid to try what else is "new and improved"

dOmBi8i-MuhJS-htpBNKqA.text: I've been here twice both late afternoon during the week and it was still very busy. Overall it was good.  Pros: breakfast selections until later in the day. Food was delicious (except for...). Outdoor area was great to enjoy the good weather.  Cons: overpriced dishes followed by every add-on being chargeable, a nickle and dime you type place.  As stated above all the food we had both time in our groups was good except for the pizza. We had 2 different types of pizza and both lacked any kind of flavor and were soft and squishy. If you stay clear of the pizza I think you will be happy as everything else we had was good/great.

v_maCLtNNLvK7990N7MqNA.text: We were so excited to try this out. Unfortunately it's a very bland experience all around.   I will say, buildout is nice.  Great patio away from the traffic, good spacing between tables and nice atmosphere.  Also, good happy hour pricing on specific beers.   The bad, food couldn't have been more bland and amateur.   I will say we ordered only one sandwich, the chips and salsas and a few cocktails, that said, these should be spot on if you claim to run a kitchen.   Chips and salsa - no salt, cold chips.  Extremely unflavored salsa, seriously nothing there. Tomatillo was no better.  Guacamole was mushed up Avocado with no other spices.  I'm telling you, we have never had a more bland experience with chips and salsa.   I ordered the Cuban sandwich, my go to judgement sandwich.  It was $13 and the worst Cuban I've ever ordered.  It was a panini I could have made at home,   on a bad night.  Seriously something we would have done with lunch meat and bread from frys.  Even the mustard was flavorless.   Drinks. Like I said, beer was a good deal.  Cocktails didn't do it.  Sangria was bland, with no fruit and in a low ball glass!  No presentation or flavor.   The Lee Trevino was good but again, in a low ball and tons of ice.   Keep in mind this is based on an app and one sandwich but these were a great entry point and it didn't go well.  There is no value here, no flavor, no experience and no reason to get food.   Go here for happy hour drinks because the ambiance is great.  Just eat before your get there.

CCovn_RaIC3O7-WSkjCH7w.text: First time for dinner on a Saturday night. Great food, great service. Look forward to trying it again!

tpkexdtOIhPetvdONiykFA.text: We looked forward to enjoying a new place. On a Saturday morning we met friends for breakfast.  The best way to sum it up: boring. Maybe we expected to much. We'll try again in the future but based on witnessing restaurants come & go they do not seem to have staying power.

i-U4Mn2UsTMPTsYGUVTEVA.text: We have visited TPMC four times now.  Opening day at 1pm. They ran out of food. What a fabulous problem on opening day! We were excited to return.  The next visit was for breakfast,(before they could possibly run out again) the next lunch and then dinner.  We love the atmosphere and the staff is friendly and efficient. I'm afraid we were disappointed each time with our meals! Perhaps our anticipation of this cool new dining experience gave way to high expectations?  The first meal was  Feb 16th. I had the quiche with a side of fruit- $10. My friend had the Devil's Mess- $9.75. She didn't finish hers. I asked for extra sauce for mine. We both decided it was "just ok"and wouldn't order it again.  The second visit was soon after the first visit. (on President's day) and they were busy. I had the chicken salad sandwich (curry based) and I was very excited. The sandwich alone was was $11! I added a small bowl of fries for an additional 4$.  The flavor of the chicken salad was very good. However the chicken portion was so small that the 9 grain bread overwhelmed the flavor and I was once again disappointed. The serving of fries was small, overdone and flavorless. I let it go because the staff was very busy. My daughter had a pizza and was satisfied. My son in law had the quiche with salad and was still hungry. Now, thinking 3rd time would be a charm, and now they've had a couple more weeks to pull it together,  we made plans to give it another shot. We went last Saturday night for drinks and appetizers. My sister had Chips, salsa and quac for $10. A friend had the chicken quesadilla, I wanted the pretzels but they were out (7:15pmish)  so I ordered Eat the Rainbow. The quesadilla was a hit. The nachos were overpriced for the amount received and we all enjoyed the unique veggie plate but the serving of dipping sauces were only half filled and scarce. So.... we want to love this place! We want to find something there we crave and can't wait to go back for,  but haven't found it yet.  Thanks for the awesome environment and Kudos to the wait staff, but I'm not excited about anything I've tasted yet and I swear I am not super picky. I'm a flight attendant for 32 years. I've eaten all over the world. So far, your selection does not warrant your prices. Other friends have said the same. "High prices for subpar food".  We don't want to be mean. We want to challenge this new establishment to do better. We know you can!

J6-5dZy04ziHDvftmIItGQ.text: One of very few restaurants where the quality of the food actually beats the hype on the menu. High quality and great value. Definitely be back soon.

DX5xP-CvZftf7wMCiZ8uKg.text: Such a unique little spot! Yummy yummy food! Highly recommend the lentil curry coconut soup. Great for fast casual.

HT43Oi4vjnulyQXSA58SNA.text: My wife and I decided to try Tempe Mkt. on Monday 3/19/18 for lunch.  It was busy mostly people in their 30's and 40's, the place was clean and bright, but the noise level would rival Buffalo Wild Wings. We found it to be trendy, a little pricey, a place that Yuppie's love. The food portions on some dishes was hefty and on some quite light. We tried the Rancher-sausage and pepperoni pizza-$16.00, when the girl set it on our table we both looked at each other like "What the heck is this", it was a cross between thick and thin crust, which was fine, but the size was small, maybe 5"wide by 10" long, a little bigger than a personal pizza in a regular pizza restaurant, even in a Yuppie restaurant $6.00-7.00 would be tops for this little guy, it did taste good though. My wife and I are seniors and I don't think this type of restaurant is our "Cup of Tea".

hYmDvlGZDvz6civTt2VBaQ.text: Don't know what the fuss is about but not worth the price or the wait in line on the weekends. Small menu, food is good but nothing special.  Because it has vegan options everyone is falling in love with it. Nice patio-staff is okay unless they are busy, then forget getting help. Too many other places with better menu options

4SXF94ne66OvGBKzr6q8_g.text: Great food, great service, great atmosphere. My food was tasty and served at the perfect temperature, and they even let me sample a soup that I wasn't sure if I wanted or not. I got an Arnie palmer and the servers continuously came back and got me refills--amazing for a fast casual place where you're not waited on. Every employee was friendly and helpful. The atmosphere of the place is amazing--has a great curated feel that reminded me of my favorite cafes in Minneapolis.

WhaGhM0wuWkaC7BCm4UTIw.text: The place looks great (awesome patio and nice atmosphere) but disappointed a lot on discrepancy between price and service and quality. Food quality is average and you have to wait most of the time in line for ordering or later to pick up your drink, which might be ready only after food. At the same time you pay as much as in full service restaurants. Not so likely to come back for more than a drink or coffee.

bCKQmCARgBvPWC8KCegQCA.text: Nice and clean establishment. Clean healthy foods. Location is a bit confusing but once you go once, you'll be fine. It's in a college student dominated are but I see people of all ages go!

DqpJ8KB_H-dQpw7k1utEqQ.text: Nice atmosphere, decent food. First time I came a while back, I wasn't super hungry. I got a cup of lentil soup, which was good but a bit on the earthy side of flavor. Needed a little more spice to balance it out. I also got a side of chicken- I got a couple of tiny chunks of chicken for around $4. Both were just super small for the amount you paid.  Tonight I came with a friend and we both ordered the AZ Burger, mine with no bun, side salad. They accidentally brought out fries but got me the salad- good on the service! The burger was well-seasoned and the chili was a nice contrast in flavor. Fries were decent- thankfully not too greasy! This part struck me as inconsistent: I got a massive piece of lovely watermelon, and my friend had a tiny piece that was pretty sad looking. Having worked in some higher end restaurants, I do know that part of a restaurant's good reputation relies on consistency of the small things like that. Just some minor things that could be fixed, but a pleasant experience!

zIaDlxbZdM9WqD5tY0GGKw.text: Returned after a poor experience during opening week. Mid morning breakfast with my family. Service was excellent, breakfast burrito super tasty, and drinks made to order. Music on patio a bit too loud. Now on my neighborhood go to list after wondering if I would be back.

st48zhRkYtlbCSSSpnficw.text: Went here the other night with a group of friends. We didn't know it was a counter order place, no table service. I ordered a hamburger which cost $11 but the only thing you get is a hamburger no side. I added a very small side salad for $4 so $15 for my meal that I had to stand in line and order. I thought that was a lot. We also ordered appetizers which we got right away but literally 4 min. Later main food came out. It sounds weird but I'm complaining because our service was too fast! We actually got our dinners before our drinks! You also have to get up and order drinks from the bar each time you need one. If I wanted that I would just stay home. I will say the patio area is super, fire pits all around. Food was excellent and the waitstaff is very friendly and extremely helpful probably because they don't have to do much, lol.

-FCBVaJ3wTJUVewSDWberQ.text: Wife and I ate there on a Tuesday night around 7PM, no line and plenty of seating. Food came out about 5 minutes after we ordered. I wanted an order of their devil fries and the server put in the order for me instead of making me go back to the cashier. Food was good, but the portions were slightly on the small side for the price we paid. I'm not a huge fan of the service style, but I'll go back.

VzwRaS-6UDpEFN2y42SnRw.text: Chips and guacamole were literally the worst I've ever had.  Chips old, guacamole not even sure what they put in it , but it's gross.  Burger was to be medium well and came out blood red as though they just killed the cow and put it on the plate.

Bjn1BICjtGMqKYur_5rfHw.text: Love the new addition to the neighborhood! The staff, atmosphere and food are fantastic! I've tried most of the items on the menu, all really good! They could use a better wine selection, but I think they are working on that. I would encourage you to try this very cool place!

65tq2H6hhKBnMAwjBxJByQ.text: This is a great addition to the neighborhood! It is such a great atmosphere, with the inside, outside, and bar space- staff is so friendly- and the drinks and drink selection is great. The only reason I am giving it 4 stars is because the food is really good, but not great. My favorite thing on the menu by far though is the rice bowl. And I have only been here for lunch and dinner but not breakfast. Everyone really has to go here and check it out!

sMf1brje783DiH5EpXDG-g.text: Have been here a couple of times for happy hour and have enjoyed the outside atmosphere and the staff is always so kind! I highly recommend the wings because they have great flavor and meat to bone ratio. The service gets a little confusing as you order and they bring it your table. They brought us items that were not ours and also a different pizza than ordered, but the chef was so nice and comped it for us in addition to giving us our regular pizza! The loss of a star is due to the limited cocktail options on the happy hour menu. They have one really interesting spicy cocktail, but the other options are all mainstream sangrias, mimosa etc.

H37JGZqonHU-2Yl1JF6miQ.text: Giving that this place just opened, our dinner was average. We tried the rancher pizza, which was YUMMY! We also had the Caesar salad (which came with kale), I usually love the combo, but here it wasn't much to write home to mom about. We also tried the black bean soup... it was good if you like straight mashed black beans. I would have preferred if there was a little bit more flavor to it! Other than that it was an overall positive experience- the line didn't take too long and the food came out rather quickly. Would definitely love to return when they are less busy and try a breakfast or lunch item.

Ats7ELfCFLZjLxOjTpfDvA.text: Great food and atmosphere! However I came out and my car had been side swiped! I called The establishment to see if anyone had come in to report it or if they had cameras. Manager told me she would get back to me to see if property management did! No return call. Beware the parking spaces are not very wide!

mZ3kVucbHIIp8wDQpiJY4w.text: Really nice spot, has a beautiful location and decorations but the food is questionable. The coffee is actually good, they got my espresso right. I for sure would go here again in the future. More of a cafe then a restaurant though :)

Tueetc7Xks-XXY9XpDiRdA.text: Nothing like starting the day with a barely warm cappuccino. Seriously, there's just no excuse for that. First time I've ever one I've ever sent a coffee back. If the cups are cold, warm them up first, or store them on top of the espresso machine!   Seriously, you have got to get the basics right, or the rest of the place is going to be in trouble. The granola was meh. And "out of oatmeal" at 730am Saturday morning?

bkJpxte2HtDe9x2Xs79t3w.text: Not a good experience... ordered oatmeal at counter, staff very friendly, first oatmeal was Luke warm, sent it back and second was also Luke warm.  Ordered yogurt...tasty but very little yogurt.  Coffee served in a paper cup, had to ask for a refill in a regular cup.  Servers never asked about refills.  Service poor  I had a positive response from Arron(?) but me never followed up on his offer of a gift card to try out the restaurant again.  Another disappointment!!

y1hssFxLgUwWQOWK_gtegQ.text: Liked the food, but thought it was overpriced. I ordered a chicken sandwich, $10.50, but a side was $4 more...ouch!  Most places include a side with the sandwich.  2 others in our party ordered biscuits and gravy. They liked the food, but it only included 1 biscuit cut in half. You'd think it would be 2 full biscuits like most places do.

agXIBZKA3rvuQwbodQGYbQ.text: This place was a little too hipster crowd for me. The food looked good and was decent, nothing to blow your mind. (We got nachos and I got the chicken sandwich) The style of ordering and having no real server doesn't really work when you sell alcohol. I guess for lunch but not so much dinner.

G79kXUZeKUrNCk5QNqtclw.text: had a private party here.  service was very good.  food was okay. fine if you live near but I wouldn't go out of my way

uhXIqP5zeYD4gt_WbEUc1w.text: Beautiful outdoor seating!!  Very cozy and inviting!  Decided to try something new and a little more healthy and glad we stopped in.  Being new restaurant, it was busy but the service staff was handling it great. I had the rice bowl which was delish!! I tried a new drink, Captain America and that was very good. G-InDeuoDL1pMMp6taMVjA.text: Rooster Booster! My go to after my workouts. Order it poached with crispy bacon! The potatoes are cooked perfectly. Real Potatoes without grease!  Bravo TPMC!

Z4G6B1ok7vLzjF8b8Oy8nw.text: High Prices, terrible service and a grilled cheese swimming in butter. avoid. Soup was ok. An extra star for trying to be cool I guess

ykagma8qlHUYHMxzXHqMgQ.text: We came here on a Sunday around 10AM, we ordered three lattes & it took at least 25 minutes just to get our coffees. We even checked on the coffee a couple times to make sure we were being forgotten. Then about after 35 minutes we finally got our food. Other than that the environment is really nice & a great place to be outside especially when the weather is nice. It would've been s better experience if it didn't take so long to get everything. We honestly would've been happy if we got our coffee within a decent amount of time.

U855Zdli-ObzWZOdpcT-Xg.text: The atmosphere at this local hangout is the perfect fit and need right here in South Tempe. It definitely has filled the niche for great food and convenient location. The hipster staff is friendly and helpful. Love it!

xlIsbK6U4SYwpY8QAI94-A.text: This is a nice joint for a fast casual restaurant!! Great breakfast and dinner/lunch options  you have to try the cauliflower steak and soft pretzels  so good!!!!!

lHqlRd9-q1OfVN7mwU7w6w.text: Technically, something went wrong at some point where me and my friend ended up waiting longer than expected and realized there was a mistake.  However, the manager handled it exactly how I myself would have handled it when I was a restaurant manager.  It was very professional, extremely sincere, and was fixed right away.  That's is all I would ever want in a situation like that.  The food was much better then we anticipated and we ended up getting desert.  Also empty tables were maintained all night and the place was beautiful with the lights and music this evening.

s-DbSBTnqhKjHj0Ui1_kWA.text: Love the decorations, not a fan of the food. Good for a business lunch or a short get together. Very convenient, not for foodie in me.

vhA-mkjWhssxM9fg5oJZzg.text: As excited as I was for the location to open I'm equally disappointed with their delivery. I'm a big fan of the chef and often drive up to St. Francis for breakfast & dinner so was looking forward to the location opening in my neighborhood.  I understand that during openings they need to work through things but my overall rating still takes that into account. This is a counter order format and they shouldn't have all of the service problems and the menu is limited and some of the food coming out shouldn't come out. I've visited for breakfast, lunch & dinner and have seen the same issues in service & inconsistent food.   Atmosphere - This is why I'm giving it two stars. Great work at the location. My only comment is to get enough chairs on the patio so that we can use all the tables they have.  Service - Lacking in all areas. If the line is out the door then open the 2nd register, common sense. Even though I know what I'm ordering the order taking process is painful which is why there are open seats in the restaurant but a long, long line. The food runners do nothing more than drop the plate. They don't ask if you need anything or announce what they are delivering. During our four person breakfast there was a 15 minute gap between the first plate and the last, and none of the runners ever said anything about the next dish coming out.   Food - Interesting menu but poor execution. AZ Burger - Cooked well enough and enjoyed the house dressing, but not a fan of the bun they use. The issue is the price/value when you have to order fries. The cost of the side for such a small serving is annoying considering what they charge for the burger. Add the side. The Rancher Pizza - The only highlight so far and have had it twice. It is a pan baked pizza where it is really doughy. The sausage and pepperoni is what makes it so good. Would like a little more sauce but it's work ordering again. The Devil's Mess - Not sure what to say, it's a mess. Biscuits & Gravy - Probably would have been better if the gravy came out something hotter than lukewarm. A single biscuit. Not worth what they are charging .  Frittata - Bad. It was skillet cooked and the outside edges were way overcooked and in center was under cooked. The bad part was the too large hunks of under cooked broccoli that they put on it.  Lacked flavor. Flarney Garney - Good enough but not very good. Tito's Cubano - A too small piece of under seasoned pork and a small slice of ham. The dijonnaise added some flavor but not enough to save the dish at that price, again without a side.   Beverages - Beer selection is so so. The Sangria is way overpriced for the quality of a 4 oz pour after you take out the ice.  For breakfast the drip coffee is a disaster. If you order drip coffee you have to self serve out of air pots that were either empty of lukewarm. And, the coffee didn't meet my personal preference.   I hope that they figure things out because the neighborhood needs a location like this. But if the quality of food doesn't improve, the service improve and they balance the quality/price then I'll look else ware.

zBF_nY0ryjo1GgZGHRN88g.text: $4.00 for a small bowl of greasy re-fried French fries is crazy.  The crispy chicken sandwich was average and not worth the price.  My stomach is already aching.  The ice tea is really good!   Not worth the cost.

HDz7_0h_lYunGIP8elB_jQ.text: Took forever to even order. Needs to have both registers open to have the lines move faster. They are probably losing customers from the line taking too long. Trying to be like Joe's Farm Grille but failing horribly. Ice machine didn't even have ice. Food was overpriced for over cooked French fries and greasy, sloppily prepared food.

0RCPZq4QLxtM2wxJRumSAA.text: Great food and service! Highly recommend the salmon special. Lots of vegan, vegetarian gluten-free & dairy free options. Great selection of fresh made pastries!
